What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 65!!!
보톡스(Boardgame Talks) 제41회 - Trajan, Nations

126043.name: Barons of Tea
126043.description:
Barons of Tea is a game for 2-6 players ages 8+. Put on your fancy hat, hop on your boat and get ready for adventures on the high seas!
The British Empire spans across the entire globe and the empire is thirsty. With Barons of Tea you get to step into the shoes of a tea merchant. With 300 pounds of silver in hand and a ship to your name you set off across the sea in a race with other players to be the first to amass 3,000 pounds of silver.
The game play is focused around a commission system, where players race to ports across Africa, India, China and Japan so that they can be the first ones back and receive the highest sale price. The game features seven unique teas, including two special varieties, grown in land-locked regions.

In Barons of Tea there are many different events that can change your fortunes for good or for ill. Each time an odd number is rolled a new event card is drawn. These can bring both good and bad tidings, from finding treasure to finding a dreadful sea beast.

126044.name: Twisted Rune
126044.description:
From the front page of the adventure:

The WeavePasha of Almraiven seeks adventurers to recover shards of the Calimemnon Crystal. It seems as if one of the shards has practically come to him. Elemental disturbances in the abjuries he maintains have led the WeavePasha to believe that the shard has been brought to Almraiven, and is interfering with the magical defenses of the city. Other reports indicate the Twisted Rune, a highly secret cabal of powerful undead spellcasters, may be involved, though what they are up to remains a mystery. A Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in Calimshan for characters of the Paragon tier (levels 11-20). CALI4-1, CALI4-2 and CALI4-3 are playable in any order and collectively form the Calimemnon Crystal major quest.

rpgseries: SPEC - Living Forgotten Realms Core Special Adventures
126045.name: Conflict in Calimport
126045.description:
From the front page of the adventure:

Tensions between Calimport, Memnon, and Almraiven are a constant for the citizens of Calimshan. If war were to break out between any two of these cities, the third would gain a powerful advantage. Ala’Ammar, patriarch of House Asada, seeks to free the slaves of both Calimport and Memnon. He seeks adventurers to travel to Calimport and incite them to go to war with Memnon, tipping the scales in Almraiven’s favor. A Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in Calimshan for characters of the heroic tier (levels 1-10).

126046.name: Quiz Panel
126046.description: This game from Cadaco Ellis capitalizes on the 1950's TV quiz show craze. There are 200 total questions in eight different series (25 questions each). In the standard game each player is given a quiz series sheet and quizzes (from their own sheet) the player on the right. The answering player silently places a peg in the yes or no holes on the board. The quizzing player then uses the code given on his/her series sheet for that question to turn the dial on the board and show the hidden answer. Players receive one point per correct answer. The player with the highest number of correct answers/points at the end of the game wins. In the party version all players work off the same quiz series sheet.

rpgseries: SPEC - Living Forgotten Realms Core Special Adventures
126047.name: Mischief in Memnon
126047.description:
From the front page of the adventure:

An uneasy truce between three cities has led to a delicate balance of power. If any two were to wage war, the third could grow strong enough to swiftly conquer all of Calimshan. One ambitious human aims to ensure that the city of
Almraiven emerges victorious once the dust has settled. With the cunning and prowess of a small band of adventurers, the last bastion of humanity in the region may yet triumph over the evil empires of Calimport and Memnon. A Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in Memnon for characters of the Paragon tier (levels 11-20).
Note: This adventure is playable by characters that had previously played SPEC4-3 when they were Heroic tier.

126048.name: The Game of Hitch Hiker
126048.description: Players try to complete a travel route across the board using a spinner and action cards. The first to reach their destination wins. On each turn the spinner directs player movement. Spaces on the board can direct you to jump to other locations or to draw cards which can slow you down (take a slow vehicle) or speed you up (take a fast vehicle). They can also (as in Monopoly) send you to jail or to the Hitch Hiker hospital. As is often the case in the 1930's, the Hitch Hiker theme is pasted on.

126049.name: BAM! Basic Action Magazine (Issue 5)
rpgissuearticle: BASH! Fantasy: Legends of Steel Preview
Online Gaming with BASH! UE and MapTool
126049.description:
From publisher blurb:

Special "Landscape Edition" Issue Contents:

Let's Get Granular: 3 Ways to bring more Granularity to BASH! Stats.
To The Rescue: Controllers: Article explaining good choices for making controller archetype characters and also new uses for the X Mastery power.
New Stuff: New Powers, Advantages, and Disadvantages
Character Spotlight: Mystical Ninja, Elementalist, & Living Cartoon
Ron's Ripping Character Sheet: Landscape character sheet which includes the Dice Roll Chart.
Playing BASH! Online with Maptool: Article explains the BASH! Maptool framework and where to get it
Preview: BASH! Fantasy: Legends of Steel: Jeff Mejia's Sword & Sorcery setting is being combined with updated BASH! Fantasy rules. Find out more about this upcoming stand-alone game set in the world of Erisa.

126050.name: Cold Soldier
126050.description:
From the publisher's website:

You are the dead returned to life, brought back by a dark master to carry out his cruel tasks. Husk and dark weapon that you are, though, your humanity flickers in you like a candle burnt low. Cold Soldier is a 2-player game that requires paper, pencil, playing cards, and 1.5 to 2.5 hours.

rpgartist: Bruno José Ferreira de Souza Peixoto
126051.name: BAM! Basic Action Magazine (Issue 6 - 2004)
rpgdesigner: Bruno José Ferreira de Souza Peixoto
rpgissuearticle: Heroes Unite: Superteams in BASH! UE
126051.description:
From publisher blurb:

The fans have taken over! This issue of BAM! was put together, laid out, illustrated, and written by supportive fans who've gone above and beyond!

This issue is a beatiful 42 page Bountiful BASH! Bonanza!

This issue you'll get"

Heroes Unite: An article featuring special rules for super hero teams.
A Preview of Awesome Powers, the upcoming supplement for BASH! UE
Adversarium: BAM-Packed with pleny of villains to face even the greatest of heroes.




And if that hasn't sold you on this free product, I've got two more words for you:
Disco Villains

126052.name: Screaming Silence
126052.description:
Introduction
You may have been told that knowledge is power, but how much of this do you actually believe? In our world, information is given away for almost nothing. Just spend a few hours on the Internet and see for yourself. But in the world of the Screaming Silence, knowledge is more than power, it’s more than gold or fame. In the world of the Screaming Silence, knowledge is only thing worth fighting for...

The Screaming Silence are members of Mainstream Society, the Know-nots, who have learned of the existence of the Knows. They wish to take some of the knowledge that the Technocracy keeps for itself, and topple their oppressive Communist government. This is the world that the player characters have been born into, and its a world that rests upon their shoulders. Can the players dislodge the World Government
before it collapses totally in on itself? And can they stop the Technocracy for taking control? Only the players of the Screaming Silence can decide.

126053.name: Zond
126053.description:
ZOND, named for the Soviet manned lunar orbital program, is an easy to play game of worker/resource management and action selection, featuring an idealized view of the Space Race, beginning in 1957 and ending in 1987, by which time the Soviets had confidently predicted that they would be launching a manned mission to Mars. Players may represent the American, Chinese, European, Soviet, or Zambian (!) Space Programs.

Player interaction is based upon strategic action selection and the use of an Espionage Deck, reflecting various game altering events, conditions, and missions that may be used to assist or slow the progress of the various space programs represented in the game.

This is a tongue in cheek game, based upon idealized history, and while many of the events and actions are based upon historical fact, it should not be misconstrued as a straight laced simulation.

126055.name: Toe TacTix
126055.description:
This is a game, along the lines of normal tic-tac-toe, with several difference. First, it features a Toe piece that stuns pieces of players that are adjacent to it vertically or horizontally, so these pieces can't be relocated during the relocation phase. Second, players are limited to only 3 pieces per side. Third, a player can lose the game if they are not able to relocate any of their pieces during the relocation phase of the game.

The name is based off reversing the words "Tic Tac Toe" and using a Toe piece as a blocker.

126057.name: Master of Monsters: Disciples of Gaia
126057.description:
From back of game case

Who will defeat the once noble Gaia?
Choose from six of Gaia's disciples and conquer a land consisting of mountains, lakes, oceans, streams, rivers, and snow to overpower the now evil master, Gaia. Conquer this fantasy land that is controlled by swords, magic and wizardry. Summon monsters, fight enemies and cleanse the Earth of chaos. Here's your chance to save the world once and for all!

Masters of Monsters: Disciples of Gaia is a unique multi-player, turn-based strategy game.
- Offers hundreds of hours of gameplay.
- Over 40 different maps to explore and conquer.
- Summon and control over 85 monsters to battle your enemies.
- Six different playable characters for a variety of mastery.
- Up to 4 players for maximum competition.
- Three modes to select from: story mode, single map, and vs. mode.
- Fuse monsters to create more powerful creatures.
- More than 200 items, weapons, and magics.

126058.name: Dead Rage: Prologue
126058.description:
The 2012, a terrible variation is happening......Being a survivor in this dangerous and ruthless world, you face the endless zombies, but what's worse is the mystery behind all of this.
In 2012, the sun activate abnormally, the earth's interior energy balance system facing collapse. Maya prophecy proved to be true,and the human are facing vanish from the earth. The biological weapons in many countries have leaked. The victims of these biochemical weapons gradually became zombies and constantly attacked the survivors. People attacked by zombies are also infected by the virus and become new zombies. Life is full of panic. In such circumstances, as a former contract killer, you decide to stand up and resist the vicious zombies attack to save humanity!

Source: The Developer Website.

126061.name: Home Invasion
126061.description:
From the publisher's website:

It’s a nice middle class neighborhood with a nice mix of professional families and a nice, powerful homeowners association. Good people who get involved and know their neighbors. People who aren’t afraid to tell you that the shade of blue you are painting your house is not exactly allowed by the association covenant.

But lately things have been unsettled around Poppleton Terrace – property values are falling, crime is rising, long-time residents have been less than receptive to the suggestions of the standards committee, and now new people are moving in. People who are not like us. At all.

Home Invasion shares a number of locations with other playsets, making it a lovely candidate for multi-session play. Tales from Suburbia, in the Fiasco book, is one. Sharp-eyed enthusiasts will note others.

126062.name: Mystery Of Arkham Manor
126062.description:
User Summary

Mystery Of Arkham Manor is an adventure game in which the player investigates strange events in a country manor. The player must write articles and send them back to the London Chronicles to earn money, and try to keep a high enough Sanity score. The game is split in two parts.

The back of the box says:

"Arkham village, June 23, 1924

Something fishy's going on here.

Can't put my finger on it - yet - but already I've got a feeling that things aren't what they seem in this sleepy backwater. Something terrible's about to happen...

Meanwhile, I'd better file my first article. The editor of the London Chronicle has issued me with one of those new-fangled plate cameras to photograph events and suspects, and he expects me to send in full-page layouts, complete with headlines and pictures! He reckons this could be the news story of the century.

That is, if I stay alive long enough to write it..."

rpgitemversion: Oltre la Porta del Giorno del Giudizio
126063.name: Beyond the Doomsday Door
126063.description:
From the publisher's website:

The hunt for the seven shards of the Shattered Star leads the heroes back to the western coast of Varisia, to the multifaith monastery known as Windsong Abbey. The next shard of the Shattered Star appears to be hidden somewhere within the dungeons below the abbey. But when the PCs arrive, they find the monastery in ruins and held by savage giants and twisted fey! An ancient terror has returned home, and now dwells within the deep dungeons below—a terror who hopes to open the dread Doomsday Door deep within!

Beyond the Doomsday Door is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventure for 10th-level characters. This volume continues the Shattered Star Adventure Path, in which players explore dungeons and wilderness in search of a powerful artifact. This volume offers an examination of the monstrous proto-demons known as qlippoth and an essay on Groteus (god of oblivion and ruins). New monsters fill the Pathfinder Bestiary, while Bill Ward's Pathfinder Journal fiction explores the seedy underbelly of the scoundrel haven of Riddleport!

Each monthly full-color softcover Pathfinder Adventure Path volume contains an in-depth adventure scenario, stats for several new monsters, and support articles meant to give Game Masters additional material to expand their campaign. Pathfinder Adventure Path volumes use the Open Game License and work with both the Pathfinder RPG and the world’s oldest fantasy RPG.

126064.name: Mystery Monsters Revisited
126064.description:
From the publisher's website:

Know the unknown as you explore the lore and inner workings of the Inner Sea’s most elusive creatures in Pathfinder Campaign Setting: Mystery Monsters Revisited!

Unravel the myths behind legendary creatures inspired by real-world monsters, like the blood-sucking chupacabra, the larger-than-life sasquatch, and the mountain-dwelling yeti—and discover how they fit into the award-winning Pathfinder campaign setting alongside such infamous favorites as the equine Sandpoint Devil and disaster-heralding mothman. Each mystery monster includes examples of its misdeeds, evidence the fiend leaves in its wake, and a sample stat block of an especially nefarious version of the beast.

In a world where little is as it seems and the monsters are always one step ahead of their pursuers, get the upper hand with Pathfinder Campaign Setting: Mystery Monsters Revisited!

126065.name: People of the North
126065.description:
From the publisher's website:

Rugged lands and merciless cold breeds hard, cunning people who do what they must to survive. Such are the ways of the northlands of the Inner Sea region, and the fierce people of the deadly nations of Irrisen, the Lands of the Linnorm Kings, and the Realm of the Mammoth Lords. Learn the secrets of these brutal frontiers, whether as a master of icy magic, a hunter who tracks through the fiercest polar blizzards, or as one of the region’s cunning natives, like the Ulfen vikings, savage Kellids, Erutaki hunters, or mysterious Snowcaster elves. The lands, people, magic, and secrets of this brutal frontier are yours to discover with Pathfinder Player Companion: People of the North.

Each monthly 32-page Pathfinder Player Companion contains several player-focused articles exploring the volume’s theme as well as short articles with innovative new rules for all types of characters, as well as traits to better anchor the player to the campaign.

126066.name: Fangwood Keep
126066.description:
From the back of the book:

Fangwood Keep has changed hands innumerable times since its founding decades ago on the border between the warring nations of Molthune and Nirmathas. Over the years, both countries have sacrificed money and soldiers in an effort to control the fortress along the Marideth River valley, both for its tactical location and for its secure defenses. Recently, however, the battles around Fangwood Keep have dwindled to a trickle as Nirmathas has firmly rooted itself in the surrounding valley, allowing the tide of war to shift elsewhere and peace to settle at last over Fangwood Keep.

This respite was shattered by the arrival of a renegade Molthuni commander named Pavo Vos. Obsessed with capturing Fangwood Keep and unraveling the fortress’s mysteries, the defecting lieutenant unlawfully used his platoon to secure the castle, much to the ire of both the Molthuni and Nirmathi governments. Now the task of bringing Vos to justice and reclaiming Fangwood Keep for Nirmathas lies solely in the PCs’ able hands.

Fangwood Keep is an adventure of infiltration, investigation, and dungeon exploration for 4th-level characters, written for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and compatible with the 3.5 edition of the world’s oldest RPG. This volume also contains a gazetteer of the Marideth River valley and a brand-new monster from the bizarre realm of the fey, both of which can easily be integrated into any campaign setting.

126067.name: NPC Codex Box
126067.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Whether they be vile villains, able allies, or anything in between, the characters of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game NPC Codex come alive on your tabletop with this box-busting collection of more than 300 character pawns, plus twenty 1" and five 2" round plastic bases for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or any tabletop fantasy RPG!

Printed on sturdy cardstock, each pawn contains a beautiful full-color image of a character from the NPC Codex, as well as common animal companions, and numerous never-before-illustrated characters. Each cardstock pawn slots into a size-appropriate plastic base, making it easy to use in play alongside traditional metal or plastic miniatures. With multiple pawns of the most useful characters allowing you to create every single encounter from the NPC Codex’s encounter groups appendix, the NPC Codex Box is the best way to ensure you’ve got the right characters to push your Pathfinder campaign to the next level!

126068.name: Dungeon Dwellers
126068.description:
From the publisher's website:

Give life to your NPCs with Dungeon Dweller Face Cards! More than 50 monsters and dungeon-themed characters put their worst face forward in this gorgeously illustrated deck designed for use with the smash-hit Pathfinder RPG, but suitable for use in any fantasy roleplaying game! With space on the back to record key information and the work of Paizo’s finest illustrators on the front, these Face Cards reveal lurkers in darkness and unlikely allies suitable for any dungeon-based scene, aiding immersion in the game and letting your players look directly into the face of the enemy!

126069.description:
You are a dungeon lord and you are drinking your favourite cavern coffee when suddenly your spy informs you that a hero wants to slay you. It’s that time of the year where heroes will come out and try to destroy you and your lair. Prepare for the attack!

Oh My Lair is a solo game where you control your minion to conquer region, collect resources to summon creatures, and defeat the hero before he reaches you.

Each round of Oh My Lair consists of 4 phases. In the first phase-"upkeep", player's minions will return back to their master. The second phase-"order", player will have the ability to control his minions either to conquer a region or to collect resources from conquered region/s or base.

After all minions have been ordered, phase 3 will start-"buy", in this phase, player can buy monster/s (using the resources that you collected during the second phase) and place them strategically to face the hero.

In the final phase of a round-"hero", the hero will move one more space towards the dungeon lord (you), along the path the hero will face monsters that you have placed earlier.

To win the game, the hero must be killed before he reaches your cave.

All you need to play


1 A4 paper to print the game.
5 or 6 six-sided dice
126069.name: Oh My Lair!

126070.name: Tactics Ogre: Let Us Cling Together (PSP)
126070.description:
User Summary

Tactics Ogre: Let Us Cling Together is a PSP reinvention of the classic Strategy RPG. Key members of the original Tactics Ogre development team have reformed to deliver the ultimate version of this definitive strategy RPG experience. Hiroshi Minagawa (Director), Yasumi Matsuno (Game Design & Scenario), Akihiko Yoshida (Character Design), and Hitoshi Sakimoto and Masaharu Iwata (Composers) return to revitalise their masterpiece for a new format. In addition, renowned illustrator, Tsubasa Masao joins the character design team. Reborn from the ground up, with reworked visuals and effects, a re-arranged soundtrack by the original composers, new character growth mechanics and the Chariot Tarot and World Tarot systems that add even more replay value to the game.

126071.name: MathTornado
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 69: Tuesday, September 27th
126071.description: MathTornado is a card game for 1 to 5 players. In the game the player solve simultaneously math calculations in the range of 1-20 and lay down cards. Each card played changes all possible solutions and this creates a lot of action. The player who gets rid of his cards first is the winner.

126072.name: Hambo
126072.description:
Hambo the war hero needs help rescuing his best friend Bacon from the enemies evil clutches. Make use of your deadly arsenal and destroy those who dare to oppose Hambo on his noble rescue mission. Now is the time to eradicate injustice in this dangerous battlefield.

Source: The Publisher Website.

126073.description:
The game board represents a stable. It is three-dimensional, with stable doors opening individually. At the front of the stable there is a circuit around which the players race their horses.
There are two versions, one for older and one for younger children. In the former, players have to answer questions to get food for the horses or move obstacles. Movement is determined by a die roll; obstacles within the range of the roll can be overcome by answering another question.
In the latter, only number cards are used. Every player secretly chooses a number card. The active player moves the number of fields shown on the number card; the other players can move one field if they chose the same card as the active player.
The first player to cross the finish line is the winner.
126073.name: Ein Tag auf dem Reiterhof

126074.name: Sins of a Dark Age
126074.description:
In Sins of a Dark Age the Commander is responsible for managing the high level tasks and strategy such as base building, defense positioning, scouting, supplementary resource acquisition, army building, army control, timely use of your specific Commander's Realm Powers and more. You choose your Commander type at the beginning of the match and he/she does not have a 3d avatar in the game session. Heroes are responsible for supporting their Commander's army in battle, annihilating the enemy Commander's army, assassinating enemy Heroes, collecting additional resources and much more depending on the specific Hero type. You choose your Hero type at the beginning of a match and he/she is represented by a fully controllable avatar in the game session.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sins of a Dark Age", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

126075.name: Skulls of the Shogun
videogamehonor: 2011 Game Critics Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee
126075.description:
Skulls of the Shogun is a turn-based strategy video game developed by 17-BIT. The game is inspired by Advance Wars and features turn-based combat between undead samurai. Skulls of the Shogun was originally planned for a 2012 release on Xbox Live Arcade and Windows 8. The game is available for Xbox 360, Windows, and Windows Phone.

In June 2013, 17-BIT released Skulls of the Shogun: The Bone-A-Fide Edition on Steam for Windows XP (SP 3) and up, with 4 new campaign levels, a new character, new multiplayer levels and progression system, and developer's commentary.

Source: Wikipedia, "Skulls of the Shogun", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

126076.description:
In Sheepdogs of Pendleton Hill, each player takes the role of a sheepdog and uses card play to move flocks of sheep up the hill to the shepherds. The higher a player's sheep gets before meeting its shepherds, the more points he will score. The player who scores the most points wins.

Each player has shepherds to place on the board and sheep to place into flocks and move. Flocks often contain sheep from many players and cooperation can be key to moving a flock into an advantageous position. But how long will this helpful, peaceful pastoral scene last when the cards require players to take actions for other players which can include placing opponents' shepherds in lower scoring areas and moving flocks that do not contain their own sheep?And a hungry wolf ever lurks in the background...

A deck of cards is used by the players to take actions such as placing shepherds, putting sheep into flocks, moving flocks of sheep, and moving the wolf. It is these cards, with their requirement to manipulate other players' pieces, that drive the decisions the players must make in the game and guarantee a high level of interaction among players. Each player also has a Sheepdog wild card for use once per game.
126076.name: Sheepdogs of Pendleton Hill
boardgamepodcastepisode: House Rules 39: Interview with the Designer of Sheepdogs

126077.name: God Eater 2
126077.description:
The game takes place 3 years after Gods Eater Burst. A new pandemic caused by "Red Rain" has struck the Far East Branch. Members of Special Forces "Blood", an affiliate of Fenrir who reside in a mobile base, are sent to investigate. It will feature a new setting, as well as new protagonist, new monsters, and new weapons.

Yusuke Tomizawa, producer of God Eater, said "God Eater 2 was to pinpoint what users found fun about the game; we're taking it apart and reassembling it from scratch."

Source: Wikipedia, "God Eater 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

126078.name: Kongegammon
126078.description:
This modern two-player-game is inspired by The Royal Game of Ur. The board is a replica of the board of The Royal Game of Ur. However, in this game each player has 9 unmarked black or white pieces, respectively, and the game is played using two standard (i.e. modern) four sided dice.

In turns, players throw the two dice, and then enter one or two pieces, or move one or two pieces. The pieces enters the board at the specific start for each player, and then moves along a specified path from start to end, where the pieces are moved off the board. The movements of the pieces across the board (with special rules for the rosettes) as well as the rules for sending an opponent’s piece back to start reminds of (but are substantially different from) those listed for The Royal Game of Ur.

The winner is the player who first gets all his/her nine pieces moved all the way from start to end and off the board.

126079.name: Maya
126079.description:
Maya is a Pachisi inspired racing game with a Mayan theme. Each player has four pieces of identical colors (red, green, blue, or yellow), each marked with a specific symbol (sun, moon, cloud, spears). The board consists of an outer square track and two additional paths, perpendicular to each others, connecting the center tiles of opposing sides of the outer track, thereby subdividing the board into four squares.

The pieces start (sorted according to symbols) at four specific positions at the board. On turn, each player throw two standard D6 dies and accordingly move one or more pieces along the tracks.

The goal of the game is to get all four pieces (of same color) into the corresponding home (located at a specific corner of the board).

126080.name: De Bellis Civile v. 1, 1642-1643
126080.description:
This is volume 1 of a collection of miniatures scenarios for battles of the English Civil War. While designed for the miniatures rules set "De Bellis Renationis" (DBR) rules, the scenarios are sufficiently generalized that they can be converted to other rules sets.

Scenarios in this volume are:

Powick Bridge
Edgehill
Tadcaster
Braddock Down
Coleford
Hopton Heath
Highnam
Seacroft Moor
Ripple Field
Launceston
Stratton
Chalgrove Field
Adwalton Moor
Lansdown
Roundway Down
Gainsborough
Newbury I
Winceby

126081.name: De Bellis Civile v. 2, 1644-1645
126081.description:
This is volume 2 of a collection of miniatures scenarios for battles of the English Civil War. While designed for the miniatures rules set "De Bellis Renationis" (DBR) rules, the scenarios are sufficiently generalized that they can be converted to other rules sets.

Scenarios included are:

Nantwich
Cotes Bridge
Newark
Cheriton
Selby
Cropredy Bridge
Marston Moor
Newbury 2
Pontefract
Ledbury
Islip
Naseby
Langport
Milner's Heath
Rowton Heath
Denbigh Green

126082.name: The Naked Brothers Band: The Video Game
126082.description:
Box Description:

Join their band, play their music, live their lives.

Become a part of The Naked Brothers Band Tour! Use your stylus to sing along and play up to 5 instruments as each member of the band. Includes 15 of your favorite Naked Brothers Band songs, concert venues, outfits, instruments and more! You can even rock out with your friends!

-Create your own music videos of your performances!

-Customize your band member!

-You make the music with your favorite Naked Brothers Band songs!

126083.name: The Mining Colony on Elkos IV
126083.description:
publisher blurb

The abandoned mining colony on Elkos IV has been ignored for years. Now, however, two ships have vanished in the Elkos system and there are rumors of riches under the coat of ice that cloaks the dead world. Could there be something to those rumors? Or is it simply the activities of the notorious pirate known only as Luraya? The crew are not the only ones looking for the missing ships...and the truth.

The third issue of Captain’s Logs from the Sandbox takes the crew to the dead, ice-bound world of Elkos IV. This world will not give up its secrets lightly, but those secrets might be worth more than gold and riches. Face six mission complications, each with three twists, five NPCs, a table of space travel hazards, and a table of planetary hazards. Suitable for any space opera science fiction RPG.
From the website.

126085.name: Microlite20 (RPC 2008 Edition)
126085.description:
User summary

The Microlite20 RPC 2008 Edition is a German translation of the Microlite20 rules that was released at the Role Play Convention 2008 in Münster.

In addition to the standard Microlite20 rules, this book contains additional setting information for the world of Astragard. The print version is illustrated with scenes from the Brave Story anime series.

126086.name: Final Exam
126086.description:
From the back of the book

"You have one final test to complete your education," your instructor tells you. "All those who train in Cormac's School of Wizardry, also known as the Cedar Coral Wizards Guild, must learn to use their training in a very real way. We don't just send you out in the world with a pat on the backside and hope for the best; we want you to be truly prepared."

It's been a long fifteen years. You know how to channel the magical force known as "kremm," to manipulate it to your will, and to use it to change the world around you. It's time to move on with your life. It's time to prove to the world that you are worthy of the title, "wizard."

But before you step foot outside the great halls of the Wizards Guild, you must pass the Final Exam.

"I survived this dungeon myself, many years ago," he continues. "Though it has seen many changes, it is still very challenging - and very deadly. You will need more than just your magic. You will need to be smart, clever, and lucky. Less than half of our students survive."

Are you willing to risk your life and put your training to the test?

Final Exam is a Tunnels & Trolls Solitaire Dungeon designed specifically for T&T 7.5e. Including the additional spells in the Codex Incantatem.

126087.name: Atlanter vs Spaceamazonen
126087.description:
User summary

Atlanter vs Spaceamazonen (Atlanteans vs Space Amazons) is a sourcebook for SpacePirates. It describes two rival alien races. The Atlanteans have lost their home planet and roam space in their gargantuan city ships. The Space Amazons are pirates that are always on the hunt for technology and the Atlanteans.

The book also contains a few adventure seeds and a full adventure: Die Karte nach Atlantis (The Map to Atlantis), in which they search the home planet of the Atlanteans.

126088.name: BigBong-Theorie
126088.description:
User summary

BigBong-Theorie (BigBong Theory) is a sourcebook for SpacePirates. It introduces the heavily smoking SpaceWorms and one of their space stations, BigBong.

It also contains a few adventure seeds and a full adventure: Buschraub (Shrub Robbery), in which the characters try to 'acquire' a certain shrub for a SpaceWorm organization.

126089.name: SpacePirates (Oma Binkel Edition)
126089.description:
User summary

Oma Binkel präsentiert SpacePirates (Grandma Binkel presents SpacePirates) is the second edition of the SpacePirates rulebook. The term "2nd edition" was too boring, so Oma Binkel präsentiert was added to the title to distinguish this book from the first incarnation of the rules. Grandma Binkel is an NSC personality in the SpacePirates universe.

The book contains:

the SpacePirates setting
humans and ten alien races
action resolution rules
character creation rules
combat rules
spaceship rules
GM advice
the adventure Zeitraub (Time Theft)
a fold-out sector map

126091.name: Chronicles of Mystery: The Scorpio Ritual
126091.description:
User Summary

As a female student of archaeology you are searching for your missing uncle. On Malta you'll come across the dangerous secret of an old religious order.

126092.name: Gods Eater Burst
126092.description:
The game was originally released in Japan as God Eater but was later greatly improved and re-released as Gods Eater Burst. This version saw a release outside Japan unlike God Eater.

Players play as a young, previously unemployed, warrior who has decided to go up against powerful creatures called "Aragami" (Bewilderd God/Fallen God). Warriors who face these beasts are called "God Eaters". The story revolves around the six main members of the Far-East branch of an anti-aragami organization called Fenrir. The player will lead the veteran and rookie members named Lindow, Soma, Sakuya, Kota, and Alisa. While assignments will come from Tsubaki, an instructor and Lindow's sister.

Source: Wikipedia, "Gods Eater Burst", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

126093.name: Memento Mori
126093.description:
User Summary

The russian police officer Lara and Max, a former imitator of arts, are investigating a mysterious robbery of art in St. Petersburg.

126095.name: Undercover: Operation Wintersun
126095.description:
User Summary

In 1943 the British Secret Service discovers that the Germans have almost created the nuclear bomb. Now you take the role of John Russell, a nuclear physicist, who is sent to Germany to prevent that.

126096.name: Abracadabra
videogameversion: Spanish Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
126096.description:
User Summary

Abracadabra is a Spanish graphical text adventure game. The player take on the role of Clus, a knight in love with Princess Violetta. The jealous witch Saligia has cursed Clus and Violetta and you must find a way to break the curse.

The game is split in two parts, the second part is protected by a pass phrase given at the end of the first part.

126097.name: After Shock
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
126097.description:
User Summary

After Shock is a graphical text adventure game. There has been an earthquake and the nearby nuclear power plant is about to explode. You're the only member of the maintenance crew available, your job is to find a way to cool down the reactor and shut down the plant before it blows up.

126098.name: Camelot Warriors
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
126098.description:
User Summary

A platform game with four levels. Each level has an item that must be collected and given to the level guardian in order to progress to the next stage. There are many monsters to battle in addition to jumping platforms.

The back of the box says (Ariolasoft edition):

"Thou fallest asleep in the 20th century and awakest in the time of King Arthur and Camelot. Thy only way to solveth this mystery is to grabeth thy trusty sword, Excamembert, and fighteth through three different worlds to the fourth world of Camelot Castle. Herein thou wilt, the solution, findeth. Thou wilt encounter many evils that will includeth eye-clawing owls, flesh-eating spiders, killer fish and deadly plants.
Alas, four elements from thy 20th Century have mysteriously enetered this world of Camelot and thou must redresseth the balance of Nature by seekething them out.
Why art thou fighting for thy life in this ancient world? Only thy will to survive canst answer this!
Gadzooks! Thou canst not lose thy pith (or take it!)."

126099.name: Higher Faster Longer Athletics
126099.description:
Statistical sport game on track & field events, a companion game (but playable by itself) for Central Lanes Athletics.
It features different methods for resolving middle and long races (from 800 to 10.000 meters), for resolving throws, long jump and triple jump, and a third system to resolve high jump and pole vault.
The core of the game is based on average time (as in Central lanes) for each competitors, modified by several dice rolls (2 six sided dice rolls 4 time for each of the races, but with an initial roll to see which competitors are still in the leading group in the final part of the race).
Throws and Jumps have an average measure, but there are also rules for fouls and other random events, that may greatly modify the result.
The basic game comes with complete data for Olympic Games from 1972 to 1988
A second (1992-2008) and a third (1936-1968) pack is to appear before the London Olympics

126100.description:
Macabre detection in the worlds of H.P. Lovecraft

Welcome to H.P. Lovecraft’s Arkham, the 1920s. There will be many mysteries to uncover in this storytelling game of Lovecraftian terror. Using the provided newspaper, a list of allies, the directory of Arkham residents and a map of Arkham - your job is to follow the clues from location to location, suspect to suspect - to unravel the mystery and answer the questions posed at the end of each scenario.

Your score will depend upon the number of clues points you needed to visit, the risks you took to your sanity in your investigations and your ability to find the correct answers to the questions.

Match wits with Armitage's final score the man who has been exposed to the sanity-blasting truth about the existence of the age old evil! Can you beat his score?

With that in mind it is time to collaborate with Armitage’s investigations to complete your training. This is not a typical board game: No dice, no luck, but a challenge to your mental ability.

The cases that appear in print edition are:

Case 1 - A Grain of Evil
Case 2 - Flesh and Blood
Case 3 - The King Cometh
Case 4 - The Slumbering Solace
Case 5 - The Serpent's Vengeance
Case 6 - The Star of Tokelau
Case 7 - The Vanished Girl
Case 8 - Pasquel's Wager
126100.name: Mythos Tales
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ameritrashed: Episode #13
Episode 121: Mythos Tales, Far Space Foundry and Horror Films turned Board Game
Episode 12: The one about expansions and game protection
Episode 13 - Uniquely Scary Games
Episode 18 - The 2016 Blitzies
Episode 20: Blood Rage Review - 20 Questions
Episode 31 - Scythe Review with Calvin Wong
Episode 34 - 2016 Ding & Dent Awards Show!
Episode 37 :: Mythos Tales Review + Halloween Stories
Episode 42 :: Board Game of the Year 2016 - Brawling Brothers Awards
Episode 46 :: SaltCon Recap - The Grimm Forest Kickstarter Preview
Episode 49 :: Vast Review + Watch it Played & The Secret Cabal
Episode 7 - Spiel des Jahres
New Games A Plenty
The Good The Board and The Man Who Hates All Of It: Episode 96 “Joe’s Top 10 of 2016″
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 99

126101.name: Ashkeron
126101.description:
User Summary

A graphical text adventure game in which a blacksmith must bring back 5 magical items to princess Zeraphina before her marriage to prevent a curse. The game is played in real time and the location of several items is randomized to increase replayability.

126102.name: Book Of The Dead
126102.description:
User Summary

A graphical text adventure in which you are Kteth, a minor egyptian godling expelled to the world of men after your father Set murdered Osiris. Your only hope to return to your pantheon is to find the Book of the Dead and attempt the ritual allowing the soul of the deceased to travel to the Other World. To make matters worse, Horus has placed a powerful curse on you, manifested as a crippling disease which will kill you soon unless you find a way to contact a friendly God and find a way to break the spell.

126103.name: Bugsy
126103.description:
User Summary

A graphical text adventure game in which you must help Bugsy, a rabbit "entrepreneur", dethrone Al Capone as public enemy no. 1 and become the boss of Chicago's criminal underground.

126104.name: Castle Blackstar
126104.description:
User Summary

A text adventure in which the goddess Artemis sends you on a quest to retrieve a magical orb. You must explore Castle Blackstar and find the Orb, you may keep any treasure you find.

The game includes a scoring system, based on the amount of treasure recovered.

126105.name: Classic Adventure
126105.description:
User Summary

A text adventure in which you must explore a series of caves, pick up as much treasures as you can find, solve puzzles and avoid traps.

126106.name: The Ice Temple
126106.description:
User Summary

An action adventure game in which the player must find the 8 pieces of the thermionic reactor that is sucking the energy of the planet and drop them in the Galactic Refuse Crusher. The game has over 900 different screens.

126107.name: Cobras Arc
126107.description:
User Summary

An icon-driven adventure game in which you must enter the Temple of the Cobra and retrieve the treasure. There are items to collect and several characters to encounter, some of them helpful and others dangerous.

126108.name: Flying Colors
126108.description:
From the publisher's website:

A Games 100 selection for 2002. With 12 additional tiles and a bag of black and white stones, the Colormaze set's possibilities expand to over 1000 different and original games! The 40-page book of variations, especially for games that never have a tie, also adds many intriguing solitaire puzzles using the 36 tiles, 6 each in 6 colors, a rainbow-like visual treat.

126109.name: Cricket Crazy
126109.description:
User Summary

A budget graphical text adventure game. The game manual says:

"For years the tiny island of St. Malcolm had basked in the Caribbean sunshine, cut off from civilisation save for an old T.V set owned by the chief. The population became obsessed with the game of cricket, almost to the point of fanaticism. It was with relish then that the islanders agreed to a tour from the U.K. Unkown to them however the British Government had discovered that St. Malcolm was in fact rich in a certain natural resource, Guano.

It was this which had prompted the tour and it was the minister who was to accompany that tour who souqht to qain the rights to it.

You are manager of the team picked to visit the island. It should be a tour like any other and make a pleasant break from the rigours of the British winter. What could go wrong?

In Part 1, you must guide your team to the St. Malcolm Cricket Ground, then in Part 2, you must play the match itself.

This is your big chance to steer your lads to victory and earn your place in cricketing history. Good luck to you!

You'll need it!!!"

126110.name: Detective
126110.description:
User Summary

A computer implementation of the classic boardgame Clue, for up to 9 players.

126111.name: Shark
126111.description:
User Summary

A budget shooter heavily inspired by Cybernoid.

The back of the box says:

"FIRE FISH HQ, have lost contact with the undersea mining complex, Atlantic Five. We believe our arch enemies THE SNAKE BROTHERS and their reptilian henchmen have over-run the top secret installation.

Our only hope is the SHARK, a futuristic submersible, equipped with a devastating payload of destructive weaponry."

126112.name: Taskforce
126112.description:
User Summary

A budget shooter in which the player must collect access codes while battling hordes of enemies. Each time the player picks up a code, a Tower of Hanoi puzzle must be solved in order to collect the code successfully.

The back of the box says:

"Mercenaries led by the evil Snide Gantree have over-run our top-secret South Pacific Air-Force base.

In less than four hours, Snide will be in control of the bases awesome cruise-missile arsenal. Earths only hope is THE TASK-FORCE, a state-of-the-art jetfighter bristling with destructive firepower: missiles, heat seekers, mines, orbitals and bouncing bombs."

126113.name: Dodgy Geezers
126113.description:
User Summary

A graphical text adventure game in which you're a gangster fresh out of jail and looking for one last lucrative job in order to retire. You have to recruit gangsters and organize this last job. The other side of the game cassette has a music track (performed by the game authors) which contains clues in the lyrics.

126114.name: Contraption!
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
Spanish Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
126114.description:
User Summary

A platform game in which the Professor must collect each screen's golden apples in order to power The Contraption.

126115.name: Don Quijote
videogameversion: Spanish Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
126115.description:
User Summary

A graphical text adventure game inspired by a Spanish TV series adaptation of Miguel Cervantes' famous book. The game is split in two parts, the second parts is protected by a passphrase.

126116.name: Dungeons, Amethysts, Alchemists 'n' Everythin'
126116.description:
User Summary

A satyrical graphical text adventure in which you must escape your cell in the bottom of the Dungeon and bring back an Amethyst to the Alchemist.

126117.name: Escape From Khoshima
126117.description:
User Summary

A budget graphical adventure game in which you're a British P.O.W. escaping from the Khoshima japanese prison camp. You must escape the camp and survive the many perils of the trip through the surrounding jungle.

126118.name: Adventure D: Espionage Island
videogameversion: English/European ZX Spectrum (Sinclair Research re-release) edition
126118.description:
User Summary

Text adventure. The back of the box says:

"You have been sent on a reconnaissance mission to observe an enemy island. Somewhere, hidden on the island, is a secret. Your mission is to observe the island. Unfortunately, one of your engines is hit by enemy fire and you are forced to abandon your plane. Your adventure begins in the areoplane and leads to the heart of the enemy stronghold. You must then return to your aircraft carrier, but beware, your side may be fooled by your disguise."

126119.description:
Muskets and Tomahawks is a skirmish game, designed to represent the Petite Guerre, the small wars fought in North America during the late 18th Century between the British, French, Americans and Native Americans. It is a card driven tabletop miniatures wargame.

Troops are divided into seven types each of which is represented by a number of cards, depending on the type which grant a number of actions again depending on the troop type. Troops also have four characteristics, Movement, Aggressiveness, Defence and Marksmanship and may also have Traits. Officers are represented and activate separately from their units.

The rules provide a points systems, a scenario generator (which determines the game objective) and a side plot generator for the officers which can modify the game result.
126119.name: Muskets & Tomahawks: Skirmishes in North America during the 18th century
boardgamepodcastepisode: Meeples & Miniatures - Episode 88 - Muskets & Tomahawks

126120.name: Fantasia Diamond
126120.description:
User Summary

A graphical text adventure game. The back of the box says:

"The magnificent Fantasia Diamond, a family heirloom, has been stolen and taken to the imposing fortress across the river. Boris the Masterspy, sent to retrieve the Diamond has been captured and imprisoned. Now it is up to you...

Meet many characters - the Guardian, the Toy Robot, the Conductor - each with his own life and personality. Some of them have a strong sense of purpose and should be handled with great care..."

126121.name: Pyroblazer
126121.description:
Pyroblazer® is a futuristic combat racing game. Set amidst the awe-inspiring locations of New Apeiron, players get the opportunity to race through a multitude of environments using a wide selection of anti-gravity craft known as Blazers. In their quest for glory, players can blast their way through the scorched valleys of Gnosis, the deserted cities of Haedra or the densely populated Underdome of Evelads.

As the players fight their way through the championship, improved Blazers with better speed, handling and superior firepower become available. Players also have the ability to pick up weapon and ammo upgrades during the race, further enhancing their ability to land the killer blow.

Featuring over 15 blazers and 40 levels, the game offers an unforgettable thrill ride.

Source: The Game Website.

126122.name: Football Frenzy
126122.description:
User Summary

A graphical text adventure game in which, as the manager of the Grimesditch Rangers football club, you must solve your many team's problems and help them win the FA cup.

126123.name: Gems Of Stradus
126123.description:
User Summary

A graphical text adventure in which the player must navigate through the 100 rooms of a mansion in order to retrieve a treasure. Along the way are many guardians, traps and puzzles.

126124.name: Hunchback The Adventure
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
126124.description:
User Summary

A graphical text adventure following the adventures of Quasimodo the hunchback as he tries to save Esmeralda the gypsy from the clutches of the Cardinal.

126125.name: Tanium
126125.description:
User Summary

A budget side-scrolling space shooter. No in-game music.

Programmed by Mike Ware.

126126.name: Havoc
126126.description:
User Summary

A budget vertical scrolling shoot'em up. The back of the box says:

"Pilot your way through seven dangerous war zones, in this incredibly realistic gunship simulation. Opt to take command either of the U.S. AH-64 APACHE - the original GUNSHIP - or the Soviet's Mi-28, the most lethal attack aircraft in the Soviet air-fleet, known to N.A.T.O. Military Intelligence as "HAVOC"".

126127.name: De Wijnkenner
126127.description:
From the box: "Everything you wanted to know about wine but never dared to ask." A route through the wine country full of traps and surprises. Through the challenges you will be faced with over a 1000 different questions about wine, easy, hard and unexpected. The trip will take you through history, France and the rest of the word. It will call upon your ingenuity, logic and general knowledge making it a fun game for all.

The game is a simple roll the dice and answer the question at its basis. There are three colors of questions: mauve (a bunch of grapes) concerning general questions about wine, pink (the letter H) covering a historical question and blue (globe) which is a geography related question. Every correct answer gets you a 'Bravo' card of the relevant color, three of which in turn allow you to enter one of the guilds: Guild of Knights and Epicurians, Commanders of Diogenes and Rabelais and lastly the Globe-Trotter wine tasters. Unless you are a member of all three guilds you cannot win the game, apart from the question boxes there are a few others such as: champagne cork - which acts like a snake and ladders box, Jokers - which allow you to be awarded a right answer even if you don't know it and a few others with specific instructions.

The game is also available in English, German and French apart from the Dutch version. It won a prize in 1992 at the Brussels Eureka meet. Outsiders rate this game as very hard and requiring expert wine knowledge. It is in this sense a totally different game than Connaisseur whose name it resembles.

126128.name: Hawk Storm
126128.description:
User Summary

A budget scrolling run n'gun game. The game manual says:

"You are Hawk Storm, brave and intrepid warrior of the planet Edos. The sole source of Life Energy on Edos are the giant capacitoid crystals that store energy by day, and regenerate it during the bitterly cold nights. Now the evil Neviks have stolen all but two of these crystals. The incremental power generated by the crystals is exponential. The power generated by the remaining two is insufficient to sustain normal life. Consequently the remaining Edosians have entered a Life Suspension Program, in the hope that you can retrieve the
stolen crystals before the dwindling power of the remaining crystals is insufficient to fuel the Life Suspension Program, and the last civilised life for on Edos perishes for good.

You have been teleported from the cocoon-like safety of Edos, to the barren wastelands inhabited by the Neviks, which you must diligently search, in your quest to find the thirty two stolen crystals, and save your civilisation from extinction."

126129.name: Killapede
126129.description:
User Summary

A budget clone of the popular arcade game centipede.

126130.name: Miami Cobra GT
126130.description:
User Summary

A budget racing game, with 8 tracks, each divided in 4 stages. Each track must be completed before the time limit expires. The player has a finite supply of turbos.

126131.description:
In The Amazing Spider-Man Game, players take turns rolling the die and swinging Spider-Man up and down on the city skyscrapers.

At the start of the game, lay out mask and spider tiles at random in front of the skyscrapers. After moving Spider-Man, a player drops 1-3 wooden blocks — more blocks if he's at a taller building — from the air into the playing area formed by the city walls; if he lands a block into the colored cup matching the tile in front of the skyscraper, he claims that tile. Land in the wrong hole, though, and the Lizard starts moving through the city. If he catches Spider-Man on your turn, you place one of your collected tiles in the reserve. If you roll an X on the die, you place the top tile from this reserve into an empty space, giving Spidey more things to capture.

The first player to collect two mask tiles and two spider tiles — or six tiles of any type — wins the game.
126131.name: The Amazing Spider-Man Game

126132.name: Star Travels
126132.description:
from 1KM1KT

Come along for a ride with 400 overly emotional aliens and their jalopy of a starship. You’ll learn first hand why all the hyperintelligent aliens hide on their home worlds and never come out and play.

126133.name: Unwholesome Tennancy
126133.description:
from 1KM1KT

Hard up for work in the Great Depression, you and your friends accept a job with a strange organization that wants you to hunt monsters. It turns out they weren’t kidding. The game uses the first four turns to teach you its very simple rules and help you create the characters you will play and the challenges they will face. It also uses a lot of scratch paper and you’ll have to make your own cards for the simple bid-like danger resolution mechanics (but each player only needs three.)

126134.name: Yes, but...
126134.description:
from 1KM1KT

This is an universal comic GM-less rule system. “Yes, But” is a game about always succeeding while failing spectacularly. It is best played with four or more players with a twisted sense of humor.

In many RPGs, a character is defined by his or her strengths. Players try to do something, roll and see if they succeed. In “Yes, But” characters are defined by their weaknesses. YES, you always succeed at your attempted action somehow, BUT the amount of hilarious fallout and weird consequences depends on your ineptitude at given task. The players who come up with most absurd proclamations are rewarded with Thingies, which leads to events quickly spiraling out of control. Whoever earns most thingies by the end of the session, wins!

126135.name: SMAF 17
126135.description:
from the introduction

Welcome to SMAF 17, the last surviving bastion of humanity in the world! Situated on the sea floor just off the coast of California, Sub-Marine Adjustment Facility 17 is one of the last outposts of human survivors after the apocalyptic nuclear war that occurred during October 1962, when Russia placed nuclear warheads on Cuba ready for launch and America refused to back down.

Now home to a confusing mess of ex-inmates, former prison guards, and a few politicians and military officers who escaped in the last hour of human civilization, SMAF 17 is falling apart after five years of no supplies and poor maintenance. Society in the underwater city has collapsed, and now little gangs fight for the remaining resources available.
You are one of those gangs! Taking on the role of a survivor, you will try and find food, water, shelter… and hope. But don’t leave SMAF – because everything on the surface is horrible irradiated, and you would immediately die!
The year is 1967, and boy would this decade be swinging… if it weren’t for the fact that everyone is dead.

126136.name: Fate Game
126136.description:
from 1KM1KT

The game is set in a floating island and there the inhabitants have their own struggles with life. Beyond them, the players acts as Gods which decides the lives of these people constrained in the little space that is their island.

126137.name: Techno 2090
126137.description:
user summary

A box set about technology in the year 2090.

The text is divided into two books. Rules, and equipment.

126138.name: Amalgam RPS: World of Terrabia
126138.description:
Define your own Class by the Skills you choose. A Beastman race that can be molded to fit any physical description. An Undead race that supports any race as background. A vast set of skills for Fighters as well as Magic-users that supports tactical choices in combat. Simple rules for running groups of monsters or soldiers as a unit.

(source: 1KM1KT.net)

126139.name: Drakens öga
126139.description:
user comment

Adventure for Mutant 2089. Sequel to Drakens land.

From the back of the book (translated):

It's three months since our heroes resqued the remains of the triton expedition from Kushan station. The last three weeks they heard on the news about the forest company Rainbow attacking Japanese companies, pushing the mutants in the forrest west of Shanghai.

This module contains an adventure for Mutant in the land of the dragon. Full war is raging and in the center of it is the mysterious strangers. Who are tey? Will the players survive long enough to find out?

126140.name: Cul De Sac
126140.description:
From back of the book:

Cul De Sac is a description of Paris 2091, the worlds biggest town where neon light shine instead of the sun. Here you'll find information on the sectors, ge government, crime and the dominating companies.

126141.name: Krim
126141.description:
From back of the book:

Krim is a module for you who want to play in the black sector - on the other side of the law in the hard future of Mutant. New occupations makes it possible to play Yakuza or hitman, Tatsu or courier. The criminal syndicates are described, the black corporations and the terror organizations.

126142.name: Undying Legacy of the First Ones
126142.description:
User Summary:

A neo Exodus Adventure for Pathfinder. It's part of the 2012 Free RPG Day gifts.

From the back of the book:
At the request of a priest of the Sanguine Covenant the PCs travel to a small border village in the Caneus Empire besieged by a tribe of calibans. Aggressive, barbaric, cannibalistic and dangerous, the calibans are a threat to civilized people everywhere. More is afoot than initially believed.

Exodus boasts a turbulent history - from the rise of the Kaga to the defeat of the First Ones and the events of the Twilight War. From the creation of the Imperial Alliance to the present crisis that threatens to tear that alliance apart. Great heroes and terrible villains drove its march, though even in hindsight the two are not always easily separated. Theirs were the titanic passions, the burning obsessions and base treacheries in which modern Exodus was forged and tempered.

The world of Exodus needs heroes...

Inside this adventure you will find you'll need to embark on adventures in the exciting setting of NeoExodus: A House Divided. The Undying Legacy of the First Ones adventure will serve as an introductory adventure and showcase of the NeoExodus: A House Divided campaign setting and its unique differences from all other gaming campaign on the market.

126143.name: Krilloan
126143.description:
user summary

Krilloan, the city of adventures. A city description for Drakar och Demoner.

Contains two books (campaign, and adventure), a map of the city and an in game pamphlet with 'welcome to the city'-messages.

126144.name: Enhörningshornet
126144.description:
user summary

Adventure module for Ereb Altor, taking place in Berendien.

126145.name: Magilre
126145.description:
user summary

Country module for Ereb Altor.

126146.name: Moving Target
126146.description:
User Summary

A budget run n'gun in which a soldier must find four bombs and use them to destroy four generators that power a drug trafficking gang's base. Hazards include enemy soldiers, dogs, barbed wire, mines... The player can collect extra ammo and energy along the way. The back of the box says:

"THE EVIL DRUGS DUKE OF COLUMBIA MUST DIE.

Acting on a top secret CIA intelligence report, a commando unit acting under orders from the special United Nations narcotics taskforce smuggled four bombs into his underground cocain refinery, hidden deep in the South American jungle. Unfortunately the unit were wiped out before the bombs could be put in place. As the sole surviving team member you must accomplish the mission."

126147.name: Nuclear Heist
126147.description:
User Summary

A budget side-scrolling shoot'em up. The back of the box says:

'"SHOOT TO KILL!" those are your orders. Earth has been invaded by the aliens of Tariod, they will do anything to steal Earth's only lifeline to civilization, uranium. With the aid of the most sophisticated helicopter available you must protect Earth and all its inhabitants.'

126148.name: Operation Hanoi
126148.description:
User Summary

Operation Hanoi is a budget rail shooter heavily inspired by Operation Wolf. The back of the box says:

"You are to lead a small, but stealthy, commando force across rivers, and through jungles, to a harbour where you must capture, and destroy a SUPER-TANK that is being used to enslave the population of Campuchia. Success in your mission will lead to the end of a tyrannical dictatorship. Failure will lead not only to the continued enslavery of the people of Campuchia, but also to the subjugation of the surrounding lands."

126149.name: Radius
126149.description:
User Summary

A budget side-scrolling shoot'em up in which you must destroythe many enemies controlling the Radius, a vital hyperspace transport route.

126150.name: Riding the Rapids
126150.description:
User Summary

A top-down canoeing simulation. The player must navigate rapids and pass through gates to avoid time penalties. Capsizing or hitting obstacles also give time penalties. The goal is to complete each of the four rivers as fst as possible.

126151.name: Shanghai Karate
126151.description:
User Summary

A budget beat'em up in which the player must defeat minion after minion of the evil Wang Chen before facing him for the final battle. The game also includes a player versus player mode.

Game developed by Ian Thompson.

126152.name: Space Ace (1987/CPC)
126152.description:
User Summary

A budget top-down scrolling shoot'em up. Battle against wave after wave of enemy fighters and asteroids.

Programmed by Peter Williamson.

126153.name: Star Trooper
126153.description:
User Summary

A budget run n'gun game. The manual says:

"THE STORY (OR EXCUSE)
STAR-TROOPER, MARINE CORP., HIGH COMMAND (SLOUGH BRANCH ) EXTRACT TAKEN FROM MISSION DEBRIEFING: A56/7W

Mission 'Denizen' was only a partial success. Jabba McGut, leader of the evil Alien Syndicate, has escaped us once again. Our special 'Star-Trooper' operations task force tracked him to his secret HQ complex. Unfortunately before they had a chance to attack, Jabba learnt of their plans. Before leaving the planet, Jabba made his mutant mercenaries throw any useful equipment into the bases incinerators. We believe that Earths only supplies of 5 new super alloys (stolen in a recent raid ) were also thrown into the furnace.

THE MISSION
You have been selected for this very dangerous mission. The alloys must be found and returned to our Slough HQ. You must go down to the planets surface and search for the ingots. When you have found all five, return to your shuttle for further instructions. This mission will not be easy, the bases automated defence system has been put into operation and you will have to contend with Jabbas robots. To make things worse you will need to collect lift passes, teleport access cards and forcefield protection shields, which have been thrown into the incinerators."

Game programmed by Robert Lever.

126154.name: Steel Eagle
126154.description:
User Summary

A budget side-scrolling shoot'em up. Battle waves of enemies, dodge bullets and obstacles, collect power-ups to increase your firepower.

126155.name: Street Cred Boxing
126155.description:
User Summary

Budget beat'em up game with a boxing theme. The owner of Joe's Gym is threatened by thugs who want to take over his business. He hires six men to take on the gang of thugs. The game is split in two parts, a joystick-waggling game in which the goal is to punch a bag as many times as possible, and the proper beat'em up part in which the player battle thugs.

126156.name: Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Lone Wolf
126156.description:
Box Description:

Take on terror solo in an all new Rainbow Six adventure

-Select from classical and new gear and weapons for real-world challenges.

-New solo missions with engrossing tactical elements.

-New easy to pick up and play control system.

126157.name: Rescue Heroes: Molten Menace
126157.description:
Box Description:

Save the day and be a hero!

Kaboom! A volcano erupted near the quiet town of Misty Peaks! Spring into action with the Rescue Heroes Team and help save the town! Race against a river of lava with Jake Justice, and soar above rooftops with Ariel Flyer in search of stranded people and pets. Use your quick wits and problem-solving skills to complete each rescue mission and save the day!

-6 missions with multiple levels provide hours of excitement

-5 cool rescue vehicles, including Gil Gripper's jet ski and Air Rescue Specialist's hang glider

-Awesome 3-D graphics and special effects

-Fun with learning-builds problem-solving and thinking skills

126158.name: United Challenge
126158.description:
United Challenge is a board game which is described on the box as "The official Manchester United trivia game for the whole family".

The game is similar in many respects to Trivial Pursuit. Players are required to collect scoring pieces (in various colours) to place in their playing "football". The pieces are acquired by correctly answering trivia questions about Manchester United Football Club.

Players circulate around the board by throwing a die and moving accordingly. The location of their "football" will determine which question they are asked. The first player to fill their football with scoring pieces is the winner.

boardgamehonor: 2012 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "6 years and up" Nominee
2013 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Enfant Winner
2013 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Nominee
126159.description:
Mausgetrixt is a memory game about harvesting vegetables.

One player (the mouse player) arranges the vegetables and mice under the board. On the upper side of the board, you only see leaves.

The other players roll a colour die and than look at a plant.
If there is a vegetable or mouse of the same colour attached to the leave, the player can remove it. If the die shows a mouse, the mouse player may remove one vegetable from the bottom of the board.

The mouse player wins, if all vegetables are removed before all 3 mice are removed, otherwise all other players win.
126159.name: Mausgetrixt
boardgamepodcastepisode: RJ20: Allué ens explica Nuremberg, Cannes i Essen / Bauhaus meets Amatent

126160.name: Monopoly Streets
126160.description:
back of box:

Classic monopoly comes to life!
Play as your avatar in a city filled with your friends avatars.
Play on multiple boards including City, landmark and classic.

ean:5030930092207

126161.description:
Played on a wooden board with wooden horses, jockeys and fences, Steeplechase has you trying to win a steeplechase event by outbluffing and outguessing your opponents. You race along the track to the finish line jumping hurdles on the way. Each round one player picks a disc with a movement number on it for all the players at the table. Each other player then gets to either play the disc he was given or attempt to get a better disc by swapping with another player. If you land on a hurdle, though, you can't move!

The first player across the finish line wins.
boardgameversion: English first edition (25 handmade wooden copies)
English first pre-release "Athletics" edition (20 handmade wooden copies)
English/German second pre-release "Athletics" edition (28 handmade wooden copies)
126161.name: Steeplechase

126162.name: Challengia
126162.description:
Challengia is a fun party game. During the game players have to do several engaging challenges. It's important that all players have to perform the tasks and not someone alone (looser or winner etc). Challenges are mainly fun and also good-willing like: text someone what you have in your pockets, for the next round pretend that you are in love with the player on your left etc.

There are 175 challenges in one game set. All together there are 525 challenges. Every game is a bit different challenge set.

Challengia is set-based game similar to poker. In the beginning dealer deals every player some amount of challenges. The more tasks are dealt, the longer can game last. During the game players have to get the strongest set to win a round. Whoever wins a round, can read her challenge and every player has to perform that task. That's right - winner, looser and everybody else has to do the task. Whoever gets rid of her challenge cards first wins the game.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2013 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
2013 Gra Roku Advanced Game of the Year Nominee
2013 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Multi-player Nominee
2013 Japan Boardgame Prize Voters' Selection Winner
2013 Nederlandse Spellenprijs Best Expert Game Nominee
2013 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Experten Recommended
2013 Spiel des Jahres Kennerspiel des Jahres Recommended
2014 Games Magazine Best New Advanced Strategy Game Winner
126163.description:
Tzolkin: The Mayan Calendar presents a new game mechanism: dynamic worker placement. Players representing different Mayan tribes place their workers on giant connected gears, and as the gears rotate they take the workers to different action spots.

During a turn, players can either (a) place one or more workers on the lowest visible spot of the gears or (b) pick up one or more workers. When placing workers, they must pay corn, which is used as a currency in the game. When they pick up a worker, they perform certain actions depending on the position of the worker. Actions located "later" on the gears are more valuable, so it's wise to let the time work for you – but players cannot skip their turn; if they have all their workers on the gears, they have to pick some up. 

The game ends after one full revolution of the central Tzolkin gear. There are many paths to victory. Pleasing the gods by placing crystal skulls in deep caves or building many temples are just two of those many paths...
126163.name: Tzolk'in: The Mayan Calendar
boardgameaccessory: Tzolk'in: The Mayan Calendar – Corn Set
boardgamepodcastepisode: 35 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Budget-Friendly Games
4VP - S01E05 - Corn on the Cog
AGC News November 27th 2013 (24:35)
Allt på ett kort #13 – Tzolk’in

BGA Episode 100 - Top 100 Games of All Time
Blast Off With GemPacked!

Dukes of Dice Podcast - Ep. 01 - Meet the Dukes

Garrett's Games 358 - Cinque Terre and Walking Dead Card Game
Garrett's Games 405 - Voluspa and Tzolkin Expansions

Heavy Cardboard Episode 52 – Amanda’s Top 50 & Edward’s Top 50

OBG 101: The Decision Horizon

RJ40: Licantrops, diables, neuromàntics i ramen picant

TDT - Episode # 306 - Hybrid Games
The One About Hobo Pain
Tzolk'in - Der Maya-Kalender (Heidelberger / CGE): Spiele-Podcast Nr. 175
Vox Republica 087: The Problem With New Hotness Hype
WIPNcast 103
Wooden Cubes & Iron Soldiers: “Viking and Mouse Attack…” Episode 13

126164.description: This card features a Dragon breathing fire across the sky with a broken pirate ship in the near foreground. The card was given away at Origins and GenCon 2012 only, in support of Dixit: Journey. The card will work with any Dixit set.
126164.name: Dixit: "The Dragon" promo card

126165.name: Rapala Tournament Fishing
126165.description:
Back of Box:

Cast it, Crank it, Set the Hook!
Catch monster trophy Bass and hang on for the fight of your life. Rapala puts you in the middle of heart-pounding tournament fishing action!

-Bass, pike, walleye, catfish, perch, salmon, trout and many more!

-20 tournaments on over 500,000 acres of the top angling waters in the world!

-Drive your boat to 100's of "hot spots" or that secret local fishing hole only you know about!

EAN: 047875753310

126166.name: Rapala Fishing Frenzy 2009
126166.description:
back of box:

-Experience rod-bending, heart pounding, fishing fighting action!

-Put your angling skills to the test in the hottest tournaments on water!

-Fish for your favourite trophies including: bass, trout, walleye, catfish and more!

-Drive your boat to 100's of hotspots on the world's top angling waters!

EAN: 5030917056772

126168.description:
Oh no... INVASION!!! is a cooperative game about a small community of Space Stations in some odd corner of the galaxy. The players star as the captains of these Stations who see their peace and quiet rudely disrupted when a Class-A Spawnmonster suddenly appears in their midst. This monstrous alien has nothing but bad intentions and starts spewing out waves and waves of aliens. Players have little choice but to stop panicking and start fighting. Working together closely exchanging weapons, zapping aliens, and building a smart infrastructure is the only way to stay alive.

But fighting off the hordes of aliens alone won't cut it. At a certain point, the players will have to face the vicious Spawnmonster herself. When this Final Conflict takes place is entirely up to the players. Don't do this too early, or you will be unprepared. Don't wait too long, or the Spawnmonster will have grown too powerful for you to confront her and live to tell your grandchildren about it.

To build up your defenses, you draw cards from a Resistance deck that contains weapons and Modules. Add the Modules to your Space Station to make it more efficient. Use the right combination of weapons to rid your Space Station from the ever-growing alien presence – but choose your actions wisely! For every action you use to build, the Spawnmonster sends out another of her brood to the Space Stations, sometimes with deadly consequences...
126168.name: Oh no... INVASION!!!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 60 - Does Your Heart Go Boom?
The Boardgame Review Room: Oh no… INVASION!

126169.name: Rapala Pro Bass Fishing
126169.description:
Back of Box

Dominate the pro bass tour! Compete against real life pros in tournament action to prove you're the best of the best!

Simultaneous Multiplayer
Exciting Tournament Action
Sports TV Presentation

Pro Angler
JASON QUINN
York SC.
Career accomplishments:
-21 top ten finishes
-career earnings: $731,620.60
-career weight: 3,137 pounds

Compatible with the Rapala Rod and Reel Wireless Controller

126170.name: Raven Squad
126170.description:
back of box:

Blending FPS and RTS together, creating a new and unique genre

A plane crashed in the Amazon and you were called in to rescue the survivors and find some precious data, which in the wrong hands could become extremely perilous to national security.

But now, to make matters worse your plane has been hit by a SAM! Left engine's down! You gotta jump now! You and the other surviving members of Raven Squad still have to complete your mission and just maybe make it out of this jungle alive.

GAME FEATURES

-Set in the Amazon in the year 2011, players will experience lush jungle visuals, haunting ambient sounds, changes in the weather and an enemy in their home element

-Featuring the best of both worlds, Raven Squad has both FPS and RTS gameplay combine for a blazing action experience

-A co-operative campaign that allows players to take control of a squad and play through the entire game with a friend online

-6 characters with unique backgrounds, personalities, weapons and skills

EAN: 5060182140067

126171.name: Tears of the Blessed
126171.description:
From publisher blurb:

LEAD AN ARMY OF DARKNESS INTO BATTLE!

Inside the Vale of Valtaerna is found the most sacred site to the benevolent god Mitra in all of Talingarde. From this holy site, your enemies draw power and comfort. This is the story of how you raised an army of wickedness and stormed that stronghold of light slaughtering all who stood in your way!
