No longer are you a petty servant of darkness. Here is your chance to become a master of evil. But beware! This will not be easy. There are more than just priests in the vale. This is the lair of countless good celestials who will do all in their power to stop your rise. Can you defeat them? Will you be destroyed or will you emerge triumphant amidst the tears of the blessed?

Welcome to the third chapter of the "Way of the Wicked" adventure path! Inside you'll find:

“Tears of the Blessed,” an adventure compatible with The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game for 10th-level villains by Gary McBride.
Full color art and maps by Michael Clarke
A gazetteer of the city of Ghastenhall
Detailed information about the Church of Mitra, your most determined foes.
All you need to run a vicious narrative battle with your PCs in command.
And more!




Raise your army, dark lord, and march to war. There will be no one to stop you this time!

126172.name: Racial Wars: Petronus
126172.description:
Racial Wars is the first Polish fantasy card game, designed by Łukasz Kozak. Currently, the game is designed for 2-4 players. However, in the second edition the rules and game sets for 1 player will be presented.

The War of Races takes place in Ithilion world and 12 different races and 1 neutral race take part in it. The goal is to conquer the opponent’s residence or to eliminate his leader from the battlefield. The game also becomes more strategic as you play on two fronts.

Racial Wars in not a collectible card game but thanks to random additions, the player can make his own, exclusive card deck. Each card has its own unique abilities and unrepeatable pictures.

Players start with only leader in front of them and build plateau of cards in front of them - some cards generate resources - different for different races - which are then used to put more powerful creatures into the table. Then, each turn the battle takes place - player who is currently attacking chooses units to attack and defending blocks their attacks with his own to protect his leader. The purpose of the game is to kill enemy leader.

The game is based on a fantasy world of Ithilion, which arose in author’s and his coworkers’ minds. If you want to know the new world and characters living in it, or make a new era in Ithilion world and fight at one of the races’ side, join the Racial Wars community and create with us new days of Ithilion world.

Leader's set "Petronus" is a set which includes the deck of Savands, which is based on a sandy shaman, the creator of time amulets – Petronus.

Savands are a race of desert creatures that live in symbiosis with sand and rocks. They love hot and dry air. Savands race includes creatures made from sand and stone called Seekers as well as powerful worms living under the desert sand.

126173.name: Racial Wars: Or'grakrun
126173.description:
Racial Wars is the first Polish fantasy card game, designed by Łukasz Kozak. Currently, the game is designed for 2-4 players. However, in the second edition the rules and game sets for 1 player will be presented.

The War of Races takes place in Ithilion world and 12 different races and 1 neutral race take part in it. The goal is to conquer the opponent’s residence or to eliminate his leader from the battlefield. The game also becomes more strategic as you play on two fronts.

Racial Wars in not a collectible card game but thanks to random additions, the player can make his own, exclusive card deck. Each card has its own unique abilities and unrepeatable pictures.

Players start with only leader in front of them and build plateau of cards in front of them - some cards generate resources - different for different races - which are then used to put more powerful creatures into the table. Then, each turn the battle takes place - player who is currently attacking chooses units to attack and defending blocks their attacks with his own to protect his leader. The purpose of the game is to kill enemy leader.

The game is based on a fantasy world of Ithilion, which arose in author’s and his coworkers’ minds. If you want to know the new world and characters living in it, or make a new era in Ithilion world and fight at one of the races’ side, join the Racial Wars community and create with us new days of Ithilion world.

Leader’s set "Or'grakrun" is a set which includes the deck of Dragons based on the black leader of dragons Or'grakrun.

Dragons are a race of wild beasts inhabiting high mountains of the Ithilion world. As Elerter-the Angel Creator kept his seed long in his wings, dragons have become almost immortal. Nobody really knows how long these great beasts live because their bodies show no signs of old age or fatigue. Their skin is hard like a stone, eyes will see even the remotest areas and the fire that comes out of their mouths is difficult to extinguish.

126174.name: Racial Wars: Flight over the desert
126174.description:
Racial Wars is the first Polish fantasy card game, designed by Łukasz Kozak. Currently, the game is designed for 2-4 players. However, in the second edition the rules and game sets for 1 player will be presented.

The War of Races takes place in Ithilion world and 12 different races and 1 neutral race take part in it. The goal is to conquer the opponent’s residence or to eliminate his leader from the battlefield. The game also becomes more strategic as you play on two fronts.

Racial Wars in not a collectible card game but thanks to random additions, the player can make his own, exclusive card deck. Each card has its own unique abilities and unrepeatable pictures.

Players start with only leader in front of them and build plateau of cards in front of them - some cards generate resources - different for different races - which are then used to put more powerful creatures into the table. Then, each turn the battle takes place - player who is currently attacking chooses units to attack and defending blocks their attacks with his own to protect his leader. The purpose of the game is to kill enemy leader.

The game is based on a fantasy world of Ithilion, which arose in author’s and his coworkers’ minds. If you want to know the new world and characters living in it, or make a new era in Ithilion world and fight at one of the races’ side, join the Racial Wars community and create with us new days of Ithilion world.

"Flight over the desert" is a battle set for Racial Wars game, in which there are two 55-card decks of Savands and Dragons races. This kit is a full self-contained game.

Box content
An expanded version of the manual
Two game mats
Two posters
Two 55-card decks of leaders: Or'grakrun (Dragons) and Petronus (Savands)

126175.name: Viento Libre
126175.description:
from 1KM1KT

Viento Libre - Fantasy Steampunk

VientoLibre is the most modern aircraft from Wandering Realms, the sum of the combined efforts of the more advanced (and explosive) Goblin technology, the delicate and precise inventive Nisse, elemental magic of Fay and the powerful Soul Sorcery of humans.

The four kingdoms have made sail to the VientoLibre to find out why the Wandering Realms have lost their way across the Ocean of the Four Winds, being isolated from the Lower Continents after the dense curtain of mist floating around the floating archipelago.

The flying ship sailed with a combined crew of four races, that despite their differences and difficulties have been an uneasy truce in search of the truth of the outside world. But each faction has its own agenda on the ship, and now that they are isolated in the mist …

Will they be able to work together to find the solution to the mystery, or fight each other for control?

126176.name: The Sussurus Tomb
126176.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

In a silent section of the forest, in the center of a circle of runestones, lies the Sussurus Tomb. As night falls, flickering light streams upwards from a staircase that is carved into the surrounding stone. Every night that the moon passes into view overhead, the dissonance of whispering voices can nearly be felt, but never fully heard. The tomb lies open but undisturbed, as those who descend the stairs rarely return...

The map of the Sussurus Tomb shows a stone circle with a tomb in its center near a cobblestone road. Beneath the tomb is the beginning level of a huge set of catacombs.

New adventures await you in the deep - choking roots, ravenous spiders, and a Sphere of forgotten eldritch power.

This set contains the following:
- Poster sized 200dpi color jpg images;
- U.S. Letter sized PDF with the map broken into pages

Image format:
Base size: 24x24 inch, 200 dpi

126177.name: In the Bowels of the Mountain
126177.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

This set contains the following:
- A big map with a part of Gem Mine and an entrance into the deep
- Mountain parts - Hide the unknown parts of the map!
- Poster sized 200dpi color jpg images; and U.S. Letter sized pdf with the map broken into pages

Image format:
Base size: 24x24 inch, 200 dpi, U.S Letter, PDF with layers

126178.name: Pirate and Ghost Ship
126178.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Pirates.
A word that has caused sailors blood to run cold for centuries.
A name that has haunted our history for ages, yet there are worlds where piracy is still a part of everyday life. But what happens if the crew goes to a watery grave weighed down by a curse? The barnacle and seaweed covered ship will follow its crew to the other side.

Lord Zsezse Works has made this set because we wanted for you to get your hands on a ship's battlemap that we believe is going to be a great accessory for every game you play on the high seas.

This is a three-masted and three leveled sailing ship. It's perfect to transport the biggest cargoes, but the cannons on deck appear ready for anything.

Our maps are made for 1 inch based figures, where one inch = 5 feet in the real world. In the folders you can find the poster sized .jpg images. You may use them for Online Virtual Tabletop programs or to print in poster size in a press.

This set includes the following:
- three maps broken into pages with and without water and grid
- two styles: Pirate Ship and Ghost Ship
- poster-sized Full-color images in .jpg format for online and offline gamers

Image format:
- Grid size: 1 inch
- U.S. - Letter, 200 dpi, PDF
- jpg format pictures, 200 dpi
- in Zip file (290 Mb)

One set, two ships. The real adventure is just beginning!

126179.name: Harbour of Thieves
126179.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Thieves live in the deep, nearby the coast of the dark and cold lake. Steal free their treasures from they! Visit their camp, find the key of the treasure room, or be looking for hidden treasures between the ruins!

This set includes the following:
- The big map broken into pages (10x7 inch for the easier printing), and poster sized color jpg images
- "Bird's eye" view of map
- Isometric view of map
- 200 dpi sized color jpg images for online rpg players

Image format:
1" game tiles
Size: 40x40 inch
PDF: U.S. Letter, 200 dpi
Jpg: 200 dpi

126180.name: Crystal Cave
126180.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Visit the underground ruins, hunt for rare plants and crystals! Get through the floating platforms to the fountain and experience his magical strength!

This set includes the following:
- The big map broken into pages (10x7 inch for the easier printing), and poster sized color jpg images
- Orthographic view of map
- Isometric view of map
- 100 dpi sized color jpg images for online rpg players

Image format:
1" game tiles
Size: 37x34 inch
PDF: U.S. Letter, 200 dpi
Jpg: 200 dpi and 100 dpi

This is a map, not a story!

126181.name: Kryos Family Crypt
126181.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

The game starting now in the deep, under the castle!

When you go through the rooms of the Cellar you arrive to the family crypts. Cold halls, a lot of tombs and graves. The Kryos family buries here for a long time.

Use this map with the Cellar and the Prison in the Deep together!

This set includes the following:
- Six rooms and corridors broken into pages, and poster sized color jpg images
- Orthographic view of the map
- Isometric view of rooms
- 72 dpi sized color jpg images for the online rpg players

Image format:
1" game tiles
PDF: U.S. Letter, 200 dpi
Jpg: 200 dpi and 72 dpi

126182.name: Prison in the Deep
126182.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

The game starting now in the deep, under the castle!

In the deep are many dripstones on the walls and lighting musrooms show the road to you. Here are also a lot of cells where you can find some skeletons. But here not only humans lived and died... Be roaming in the underground world, prisons and a cave.

Use this map together with the Cellar and Kryos Family Crypt battle-maps!

This set includes the following:
- the big map broken into pages, and poster sized color jpg images
- Orthographic view of map
- Isometric view of map
- 100 dpi sized color jpg images for the online rpg players

Image format:
1" game tiles
Size: 42x41 inch
PDF: U.S. Letter, 200 dpi
Jpg: 200 dpi and 100 dpi

126183.name: The Cellar
126183.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Barrels, boxes, flour bags... its a typical cellar.
But you may find something else in the deeper cellars...

Use this map with the Kryos Family Crypt and the Prison in the Deep together!

This set includes the following:
- Five rooms and one corridor broken into pages, and poster sized color jpg images
- Orthographic and pespective view of rooms
- Isometric view of rooms
- 72 dpi sized color jpg images for the online rpg players

Image format:
1" game tiles
PDF: U.S. Letter, 200 dpi
Jpg: 200 dpi and 72 dpi

126184.name: The Hunter's House
126184.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

It's been two weeks that you started your journey through the forest, but it seems that you've lost. You are almost out of supplies, tired but the strange sounds of the night don't leave any rest. You're just beginning to give up and face the thoughts of death when suddenly a little light source shines up. You can just believe that it's not an orc campfire or the ghoul's shining, but have no other choice but to check it out. Arriving nearby you see, it's the hunter's house, what just saved your life.

This set contains the following:
- a big map with the hunter's house and its environment broken into pages
- loft, cellar, and roof.
- poster sized color jpg images

Image format:
Base size: 24x24 inch, 200 dpi, U.S Letter, PDF with layers

126185.name: The Lumberman's House
126185.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Beside the Hunter's house stand the house of the Lumberman and you find not far an old mine.

This set contains the following:
- a big map with the lumberman's house and its environment broken into pages
- mezzanine floor, roof, mountain
- poster sized 200dpi color jpg images, and 72dpi sized images for the online players

Image format:
Base size: 24x24 inch, 200 dpi, U.S Letter, PDF with layers

126186.name: The Tomb of the Fallen Angel
126186.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

The Fallen Angel: fire and darkness. His sword rules over the living and the dead.

The real game is just beginning on these huge maps. The map is given, the story depends on you. Great stories can be easily materialized with the help of these maps.

This set contains four big maps. Of course, the function of the halls can be adjusted to suit your stories.

This product contains the following:
- four big room broken into pages
- poster-sized color jpg images

Image format:
- 1" game tiles
- PDF, Letter, 200 dpi

126188.name: Dark Crypts: Chambers
126188.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

What else can be done when the night falls, than hanging around desolate crypts?

This sett is the standard accessory of any brave adventurer who dare to enter the dark and cold halls. I hope that the many specter in the crypts won't scare you away from a good adventure on these beautiful maps.

This set contains four various crypt rooms broken into pages, and poster sized jpg images for printing and online games.

Image format:
- 1" game tiles
- PDF, U.S. Letter, 300 dpi

126189.name: The Crashed Spaceship
126189.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Are you out of good ideas or your stories get too boring?
Every story can be refreshed with a crashed spaceship!
Fight with the survivors on your side or reclaim the newest technologies in hostile area.

This product contains the following:
- Tactical maps (color, B&W)
- Full-color 10 page with the crashed ship and its environment broken into pages
- Poster-sized, 32x25 inch, 200 dpi, color JPG image

126190.name: Street Cred' Football
126190.description:
User Summary

A street soccer game. Players select their team of 5 players (from the 24 characters available) and play a soccer match, either against the computer or another human player.

126191.name: Shanghai Warriors
126191.description:
User Summary

A budget beat'em up in which the player must clear three levels of bad guys. A few weapons are available in addition to the brawling maneuvers. The back of the box says:

"Mercenaries led by the evil 'Snide Gantree' have stolen a US NAVY submarine, threatening to devastate the world's capitals with its awesome arsenal of nuclear destruction. Only you stand in his way."

126192.name: Spooked
126192.description:
User Summary

You're a professional ghost hunter trapped in a haunted house. You need to find the Old Man to escape from the house. You can collect insects to cast spells to destroy some of the monsters, other are invulnerable and must be avoided.

126193.name: Subway Vigilante
126193.description:
User Summary

A budget beat'em up in which the player must defeat gangs of thugs and muggers infesting London subway stations. Once you've defeated enough criminal, the game proceeds to the next subway station.

126194.name: Sword Slayer
126194.description:
User Summary

A budget beat'em up game. As Spartacus, you must first defeat other gladiators in the arena, then battle roman legionnaires as you escape through the streets of Capua, a temple and a forest.

The game includes a player versus player mode.

126196.name: The Experience
126196.description:
User Summary

A surreal budget graphical text adventure. You're trapped in an attic with no apparent way out.

Game programmed by Richard Robinson.

126197.name: Tomcat
126197.description:
User Summary

A budget vertical shooter in which the player controls the famous F-14 Tomcat jet fighter and battles wave after wave of enemies.

126198.name: Trollie Wallie
126198.description:
User Summary

A budget platform game. The back of the box says:

"Shopping for groceries could never be this awful. Wallie can only carry five items at a time from his shopping list to the cashier. He is being constantly harassed by the creepy ghouls of the supermarket aisles. Forty items complete the list but you must find them in the enormous shop first."

126199.name: Turbo Kart Racer
126199.description:
User Summary

A budget top-down go-kart racing game, with four different tracks.

126200.name: Wriggler
126200.description:
User Summary

A budget clone of Centipede. Use your laser base to destroy the pests infesting your garden.

126201.name: Deadly Evil
126201.description:
User Summary

A budget fantasy run n'gun game. The undead have abducted the princess and stolen the six Ancient Scrolls protecting the land from the Evil Ones, plunging your country in eternal darkness. You must rise up to the challenge, find the six scrolls and bring back the princess.

126202.name: Alter Ego
126202.description:
User Summary

In the year 1894 detective Bristol and pickpocket Tim are investigating the death of a noble and several murders in the victorian town of Plymouth, England.

126203.name: Balanza
126203.description:
SImilar to Blockhead! and Super Blockhead! but have 25 odd-shaped wooden blocks.

In his turn player places one of he blocks on the tower and try to make the situation as hard as possible for the next player. Who place the last block to the tower before it falls wins the game.

126206.description:
Dragon Whisperer is a family card game that explores a rich and vibrant world where you take on the role of Dragon Whisperer. Send your heirs to journey into the world as they complete quests and collect treasure vying for your favor.

Up to six players take turns playing suited cards as they attempt to collect the most Quest tokens by traveling to various locations on the game board. Some cards allow you to amass Monster or Treasure tokens to cash in at the end of the game for additional points. Other cards have game-changing effects like changing the turn order or even canceling an entire round of play with the powerful Dragon Rage card.
126206.name: Dragon Whisperer
boardgameaccessory: Dragon Whisperer: Shadow Whisperer Dragon Rage Promo Card

126207.name: Deer in the Headlights Game
126207.description:
A game where the object is to discard your entire hand of cards. Three dice are rolled on a players turn and the outcome of the dice determines what the player can discard (or pick-up) that turn.

From the box:

"Be the first to discard all of your cards and win the round, but watch out! A "Deer in the Headlights" roll will stall your progress. Roll a "Car" or "Running Deer" and dump cards on your opponents."

126208.name: Torus One
126208.description:
From 1KM1KT

Torus One RPG is a science fiction role-playing game, where all the action happens in a crowded ring-shaped space station with a circumference of 1609 meters.

Here, players will not be diplomats, space marines or romanticized scoundrels. Instead, they’ll be the workers that do all the stuff that happens in the background.

Uninteresting, you say?

That’s because you haven’t been in Torus One before.

126209.name: The EverCandy Story
126209.description:
From publisher blurb:

MAN Sector is threatened by the influence of the most evil candy of all time, and six Troubleshooters are sent to overcome this threat by fighting fire with fire.

126210.name: Claustrophobia! (1KM1KT)
126210.description:
From 1KM1KT

Captains Log, 19 May 2012. The time now is 9:00, we’re approaching the Upper Mantle… things are about to get hot in here boys!

Welcome to Claustrophobia!, the game about crazy gnome explorers on board the doomed Nuclear Subterrine*, the sentient vessel HMS Keeton. When standing around in the garden becomes too much, colonies of gnomes turn to a life of adventuring or crime, the later being the preferred, less hazardous change of occupation. For those adventurous gnomes there is but one choice, take up their shovel, wheel barrow or fishing rod and tackle the greatest quest any gnome can undertake: a journey to the center of the earth. Prepare to face hardship, danger, and more than likely extreme cases of Claustrophobia!

You have been warned.


A subterranean submarine, usually constructed by gnomes out of surplus garden supplies and powered by a home made and somewhat dangerous nuclear power plant.

126211.name: Goblin Cave
126211.description:
From 1KM1KT

GOBLIN CAVE is goblin gathering GMless game for 3 or more players. Impress your warlord with your huge Warband, and convince him that you are the goblin leader of the future!

In GOBLIN CAVE, you take on the role of a young goblin, attempting to win over the hearts and minds of your fellow cave dwellers. Everything you need to create your character is in your dice bag, as your dice contains everything you need to know about your goblin. You will need a variety of dice to play this game, but will only be rolling one.

126212.name: I Will Be Hamlet!
126212.description:
From 1KM1KT

What is this game about?

This is about how far will you go to get the part of Hamlet in the free version that the very prestigious James Maryon wants to perform.

What do the characters do?

The characters are actors who, based on their drives, will try to get The Part while being bound in a medieval castle, forced to coexist with each other; and they will perform their monologues, suspect from their rivals and sabotage their own monologue, or maybe kill them!

What do the players do?

The players will divide themselves, because one of them will be the Dealer and the Judge and the others will be the Actors players. They all will play the part of one character (Mr. Keeton, the Butler for the Judge and the Actors for the rest). They will describe whatever they may be interested, requested, or needed, trying to make their character win; the rules, based in cards games, are made for getting this done properly.


Masculine is used not because sexism, but because laziness.

126213.name: When Zombies Attack!
126213.description:
From the publisher's website:

The dead have risen and are hungry for you! So, what will you do...When Zombies Attack!?

When Zombies Attack! is a fast-paced, action packed dice game where you and your friends attempt to reach safety while evading a ravenous zombie mob!

When Zombies Attack! is a complete game which contains 16 custom made dice, dice bag, and rulebook all included in a clear clam shell package,
everything you need for hours of fun!

When Zombies Attack! is a dice game where players attempt to escape a zombie mob. Each die represents a zombie so you can play with as many as you like. Also, there is no limit to how many players can play. You can even play it as a solitaire game. We do recommend at least four dice per player. During a player's turn, the dice are rolled, the zombies chasing them, and depending on the result, the zombies are either killed, continue to pursue, or are passed to other players or into the Quarantine Zone. The first player to start their turn with no dice to roll escapes and is declared the winner. A four player game typically lasts 5 to 10 minutes.

126214.name: Tale of Navri
126214.description:
From the introduction on 1KM1KT

The Tale of Narvi is set in the Aduelle universe, a realm of high magic fantasy with darker undertones created by Jutil the Worldbringer.

More specifically, it is a game/adventure hybrid for one player that takes place on a trade airship belonging to Narvi Windrider, a prominent Azekali merchant, carrying medicine to a town dealing with an epidemic that requires powerful magical concoctions to cure.

126215.name: The Silent Void
126215.description:
From 1KM1KT

"the Silent Void" (or "tSV" for short) is a ruleslite, dice-less, play-by-post, survival, role playing game.

Pretty much everything needed to play is contained with in this pamphlet.

"tSV" has been created for small gaming groups to play via email, blog, chat, twitter, or message board. It is suggested that the group be no larger then three(3). Two(2) Players and
one(1) Game Master or GM.

126216.name: Big Bag of Schwag
126216.description:
Big Bag of Schwag is a set collecting game for 2 to 5 players. Players must try to complete their stash first while trying to thwart their opponents.

Using the familiar “draw one, play one” mechanic, players can work on building their stash as they play Weed card. Or go on the offense and use Action cards to thwart your opponent. Compete to get a full stash of 5 one strain, or collect one of each variety of the 6 strains.

Hassle each other with action cards like “Spider Mites” or try to benefit yourself with one of the Stoner cards. Play Events to change the rules of the game, at least for a while.

In the end the one with the big bag of schwag is the winner!

WARNING: This game features adult themes and has a variant that should only be used after consulting your local use laws.

126218.name: Jail Break
126218.description:
Jail Break: Four prisoners are trying to escape the Birmingham Jail and only one can succeed. Use the tools you have acquired to traverse the tunnels and dig your way out. Watch out for the Guards who will try to stop you at every opportunity!

Roll the dice to make sets of tools; the more sets, the more tunnel cards you can draw. Avoid the Guards and play tunnel cards to make your way to freedom. Your cellmate is your only friend on the inside, will he come through when you need a diversion?

Cause problems for the other prisoners by playing Guards on their tunnels, or use your devious wild die to mess up their whole turn!

The first player to make it to freedom with 8 clear tunnel sections wins.

126219.name: Sniper: Art Of Victory
126219.description:
Box Description:

WWII was a theatre of war for many combat units, working together to ensure an army's victory. Among them a unique role was played by hidden and deadly marksmen. Their ability to lay motionless waiting for the perfect shot together with their professional equipment allowed them to change the course of history with one pull of a trigger.

Become the eye witness of the fall of the third reich!

Become a sharpshooter and take part in the turning points of the WWII. Eliminate the Nazi General, who came to support the Germans lying siege to Stalingrad. Make your way through areas occupied by the Third Reich to your unit. Aid the Alliance Forces during their offensive on the Italian Peninsula to break the Resistance of the retreating Wehrmacht forces.

-Realistic sniper rifles: Mosin-Nagant Pu and Mauser98KS.

-Faithfully reproduced uniforms and equipment of the Third Reich soldiers.

-Realistic locations rendering the atmosphere of Russia and Italian Peninsula during the war.

126220.name: Porky Pig's Donut Factory
126220.description:
This is a game for young children featuring images of classic cartoon charatcers like Porky Pig, Bugs Bunny, and Daffy Duck.

The object of the game is to become the first player with zero donut holes. Players use a whimsical spinner to move a token along the pathway made of donuts. A player might gain or lose a donut hole, depending on the type of space where the token lands.

There are a number of options and the players do have decisions to make during a session. A player may move in either direction. Certain spaces give the player a choice between spinning again for a free move or setting a donut hole "trap" on the board for another player.

The player with zero donut holes who crosses the finish line first is declared the winner.

Designed for 2, 3, or 4 children ages 6 through 10 years old.

Includes a colorful board, spinner, 4 cardboard Porky Pig tokens with plastic bases, and 22 donut hole markers.

boardgamecompilation: Baltimore & Ohio: Norfolk & Western Railroad Expansion
Baltimore & Ohio: Technology Level Seven Expansion
126221.description:
The Baltimore & Ohio Expansion Set comprises four distinct expansions for Eagle Games' Baltimore & Ohio game. All four expansions may be used simultaneously or players may select any combination of expansions.


The Norfolk & Western expansion adds another railroad to the base game, the famous coal carrying N&W Railroad. This expansion includes an N&W charter, 10 N&W stocks, 10 color-coded wood cubes, 5 Coal counters and an N&W Valuation counter.
The Technology Level 7 expansion extends the historical period of the game to 1945. Five new Technology Level 7 train cards are included.
The Robber Barons expansion introduces important economic interests into the development of the railroads in America. Eight Robber Barons cards are included with this expansion; Steel Producers, Detroit Auto Manufacturers, Trans-Atlantic Shippers, Locomotive Builders and Wall Street Financiers are just some of the cards.
The Maine Lumber expansion brings the importance of the Northeastern U.S. logging industry to the game and a special counter is included with this expansion.


Each of the four stand-alone expansions may be used with the full range of players allowed in the standard Baltimore & Ohio game.
126221.name: Baltimore & Ohio Expansion Set

126222.name: Builders of R'lyeh
126222.description:
The antediluvian city of R'lyeh was constructed of cyclopean stones by extraterrestrial intelligences. Players are the shoggoth minions laying the pyramidal cornerstones of dread Cthulhu's great watery manse, where he and his brethren will wait for the stars to align. May the stones that you have quarried from the depths serve to enclose his tomb at the pinnacle of the crazed city!

Builders of R'lyeh is a homegrown game that uses Looney Pyramids (from Looney Labs) and Cthulhu Dice (from Steve Jackson Games), along with custom structural cards. A d12 or 2d6 can be substituted for the Cthulhu Dice hardware.

Players take turns adding to a bizarre structure according to their dice rolls. Each player has their own color of pyramid, and there is an additional color for Cthulhu, but players can play their own pyramids or ones belonging to each other. When any one color is exhausted, the player whose color is at the the top of the completed structure wins.

There is also a solitaire variant included with the original rules.

126223.name: Strawberry Shortcake Rescues Fig Boot
126223.description:
Strawberry Shortcake and friends rescue the friendly Figboot

The Lend a Hand and Help a Friend Game

This is a spin and move game. The object is to rescue Fig Boot by being the first player to uncover the word "Fig Boot" and Fig Boot's picture. Landing on the Purple Pieman's spaces will trap your pawn until another player lends a hand.

The winner is the one who has played all his or her "Lend A Hand" chip.

126224.name: Dizzy Dice
videogameversion: ZX Spectrum (Sinclair User Cover Tape) edition
126224.description:
User Summary

A budget slot machine simulation, with dice games during bonus rounds.

126225.name: Doodlebug (CPC)
126225.description:
User Summary

A pacman clone with a few extra features. You are the doodlebug, and you must eat all the daisies in the maze while avoiding the other insects. if you collect enough bonus letters you'll gain access to bonus areas.

126226.name: Elven Warrior
126226.description:
User Summary

A platform game in which a young elf sorcerer must collect magic potions in order to fill four cauldrons. There are monsters to destroy or avoid, weapons to pick up, and keys to unlock new areas to find.

126227.name: European Soccer Challenge
126227.description:
User Summary

A budget topdown soccer simulation, playable against the computer or another human player.

126228.name: Guzzler
126228.description:
User Summary

A Pacman-inspired action game in which Guzzler the rat must find the keys to the food stores in the maze while avoiding patrolling Frobblies. Once Guzzler has raided a food store, he's too fat to move in the smaller corridors of the maze and must seek the help of Deflator Dennis to become thin again and escape to the next level.

126229.name: Victory
126229.description:
Victory is an abstract combat dexterity game for two players. The game mixes skill and a little luck to create an abstract battlefield the players overlook and attempt to control

Each player will set their army of meeples up on their side of the table or floor. Then the players will take turns drawing cards and sliding their glass bead shooters, attempting to knockdown their opponent's army first.

No game is never the same twice and the Action cards randomize abilities and opportunities available.

Victory is awarded to the last (meeple) man standing...and the player who owns it.

126230.name: Lop Ears
126230.description:
User Summary

Lop Ears the rabbit has strayed too far from his home. While he was away a bypass was built across the land, and now he needs to find a new way to get home.

Lop Ears is a classic arcade adventure game, with object to collect, enemies to avoid and puzzles to solve.

126231.name: Lost Caves And The Tomb Of Doom
126231.description:
User Summary

An action-puzzle game heavily inspired by Boulder Dash. You must tunnel and collect jewels in each of the levels of the Tomb of Doom, while avoiding guards and falling rocks.

Programmed by Adam Waring.

126232.name: Greco
126232.description:
The Mythology Game of Skill and Chance

Greco is a Mythology Bingo game. It is a learning/Bingo set put out by The Perfection Form Company of Logan, Iowa. A caller calls out a revealed piece, and in order to claim placement of the mythological character, you have to match it to the trivia blurb on your card.

Greco is pronounced with a long 'e', e.g. "Greek-o"

126233.name: The Key Factor
126233.description:
User Summary

A space Invaders clone that also acts as a typing tutor. Wave after wave of aliens descends on the screen, and the player can open fire with a laser base by pressing the key displayed under it, but once fired the key changes.

Programmed by Paul Aitman.

126234.description:
In Carma race, players take on the role of…well… themselves. You’ve just received an email from your favorite convention, promising you a free autographed limited edition item of you choice, but only IF you get there before the other players, who’ve also received the same email. The problem? You don’t have a car, but as karma has it, neither do the others.

You must hitchhike your way there using planes, trains and automobiles… and the occasional bike from the thrift shop. Hey… it was 99 cents!
On this journey through the continent, you’ll hop into cars equipped with NOZ, turbos, and furry dice. You’ll encounter some crazy drivers who might occasionally be drunk and take risky jumps just for the hell of it. You’ll wish for awesome upgrades to your lift, but the others are wishing just the opposite.

On your turn, they’ll be praying evil things upon you. Whatever they can think of to hinder your speed. They’ll throw old ladies and moose if they have to. They’ll send birds in your engine or just simply wish for you to crash and burn. But don’t worry, their turn will come and vengeance will be sweet.

You’ll have to strategically manage your limited hand size and choose which deck to draw from. Will you draw transportation cards to hopefully get the best ride in the game? Or will you draw some karma cards to boost your current ride and slow the others down.
While on this awesome road trip, you’ll have to choose your path, or let the driver take you further on his own path. The GPS will determine this. You’ll have to stop at train crossings and travel through snowy hills, sandy deserts, big cities and farmland.

The race also has two levels of play. You can play the regular way, which is with the special ability text of the cards, or the Junior way. In the junior level, simply play without the text and use only the numbers. This will help young players learn simple math, strategy, and have fun while doing so.

But just when you thought the race was over, there’s more to come… expansions with new maps, more vehicles, more upgrades and of course…more mayhem are already in the works. Why do you think we put STAGE 1 on the box?
So pack light, head out there, and hope for the best!
126234.name: Carmarace

126235.name: Underdog's Save Sweet Polly Game
126235.description:
Object is to save Sweet Polly by moving into the blockhouse on Barsinister Island where Simon Barsinister has hidden her.

Each player has a designated start space on the board. On each turn, the player spins the spinner and moves their Underdog piece forward or backward along the path (one or the other per turn). When landing on a "Turn Blockhouse" space, the blockhouse in the middle of the board is moved one turn. There are four paths leading to the blockhouse but only one side has a yellow door that allows entrance. This door moves when the blockhouse turns.

First player to get into the yellow door and enter the blockhouse saves Sweet Polly and wins the game. Exact number not required.

126236.name: Monopoly: Best Buy Edition
126236.description: A promotional Monopoly edition given to Best Buy MVPs (according to the back of the box). Features Best Buy money, yellow houses and black hotels, store departments instead of properties, and Best Buy Mascot and Shrink Stomper cards.

126237.name: Dockside Dogs
126237.description:
From the back cover:

This was supposed to be a simple heist.

A group of well-dressed criminals arrive at a warehouse to rendezvous after pulling off an extraordinary crime.
They know each other only by their pseudonyms - Mister Black, Mister Red, Mister Green, Mister Purple, Mister Beige, Mister Silver, Mister Grey.

The plan is simply to sit tight until midnight when someone will arrive to ferry them - and the loot - across the bay to make a final delivery to the boss.

Sounds easy, right?

But things take a turn for the weird; strange things happen in and around the warehouse. Things which make the criminals doubt the allegiances of the compatriots, their own sanity, and ultimately the very nature of reality.

It is going to be a long wait for the ferryman.

Dockside Dogs is a one-shot scenario for Call of Cthulhu. Four to six players take on the roles of the well-dressed criminals, hoping against all odds that they will make it through the night.

126239.description:
"The robot was advancing fast towards the base, loaded with crystals – but the opponent team's robot was nearing. 'Bzzzzt!' Lightning sparked briefly, and the Bot changed course to unload the crystal a few meters from his base, his programming slightly jammed by the shock wave. The opponent Bot immediately loaded the crystal and proceed to rejoin his base; two other Bots were nearing and they didn't look too friendly! The mechanic sighed heavily as he knew this would inevitably end up in a melee, damaged Bots, and long hours in the repair shop afterwards..."

In Twin Tin Bots, the robot-programming game for the new generation, many corporations have invested in crystal mining after they were discovered as a potent energy source. They designed and improved robots to harvest crystals and a few people can now run a big crystal harvesting rig. Many teams work on the same harvesting plant, but the game's always on to bring more crystals back than the others.

In the game, each player programs two robots to harvest crystals from the game board and bring them back to his base. The catch is that robots repeat their programming, but changes to the program from turn to turn are limited. Robots can also interact with other robots so even the best laid plans can end up slightly different than expected.

The player who harvests the most valuable crystals wins.
126239.name: Twin Tin Bots
boardgamepodcastepisode: AP Podcast – Episodio 16: Essen 2013
Strange Assembly 122 - Euphoria
[Actus] N°43-A Olivier devient Mormon en cellule, Cobra fait un Daybreak, les Bots braillent, Munchkin rends riche et c’est la tuile pour X-Wings !

126241.name: Thunder Zone
126241.description:
User Summary

A budget first-person shoot'em up in which the player must get rid of the Zircons attacking each of the sectors of the Flavius V system. Beside the onboard laser, the player's spacecraft is equipped with a repair droid, a shield and a retractable scoop which is used to pick up power-ups.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Origins Awards Best Board Game Nominee
126242.description:
Gentle-creeps…Start Your Mayhem!
In this customizable racing game, your Hot Rod Creeps team is your ticket to glory! Each team has its own special deck of movement cards and its own strategy. Customize your Hot Rod! Add a new Engine, Weapon, Pit Crew, or set of Wheels at a Pit Stop along the way. Customize your racetracks! Make them as wild and crazy as you want, with more than 50 interlocking track tiles. Everything you need for a race unlike anything you’ve ever see is included with Hot Rod Creeps!

Key Features
• There are six teams to choose from: Epic Battle Wizards, Monsters, The Underworld, Food Fighters, Aliens and Rockabilly!
• Build your own track! Dangerous Curves, Pit Stops, “The Jump”, and Hazards are but a few of the dozens of track pieces that allow you to create the track of your dreams… or nightmares!
• Each Hot Rod has its own deck and its own unique strategy. Your deck doubles as your Gas Tank. Run out of cards and you run out of gas!
• Players also have access to the powerful, but often dangerous, Nitro deck. Blaze a trail to the front of the pack, but watch out – you might get burned!
• Customize your Hot Rod with cards like the Horrific Hamster Haven, the Black Plague Rat-apult, the Ketchup Mechanics, or the Clown Car Corner Clingers. Blast your opponents as you blow by them.
126242.name: Hot Rod Creeps

126243.name: Transmuter
126243.description:
User Summary

A side-scrolling shoot'em up. The player's craft, the Transmuter, can collect energy from nearby explosions and turn it into extra weapons.

126244.name: Artaban, the Revolution of Dice
126244.description:
Dice have rebel!
They don't want to be a mere accessory that can be rolled carelessly. They propose a game where they are the main characters. There will be two factions. Each faction will organize itself on one side of a chessboard. The number of the dice will be its strength, and it will change every time it's moved. The strong will eliminate the weak.

And the battle starts at the cry of "Alea non jacta est"


In Artaban, each player controls seven 6-sided dice and a Leader Die (Which is just another 6-sided dice, but bigger than the other ones), for a total of 8 dice. The game starts with each player placing his dice on their second nearest row of the chessboard. (The face-up number of a die is its "value". At the start of the game, sum of the values on the 8 dice must be 28). The objective is to move the dice to their last line of the board. To achieve so, players alternate turns where they have four available options:

1. Move a die left, right, or to the front by flipping the dice over (The top face ends being the left/right/front face respectively).
2. Turn a dice 90º to the left or the right (without changing the topmost face).
3. Capture an opposing die by placing a die (without turning/flipping it) on a square it could legally move to, but is occupied by an opposing die of less value (The Leader Die can capture dice of less and equal value, but can be captured just like any other die). [A variant allows dice to capture diagonally]
4. Sacrifice a die by "capturing" an opposing die of the same value (Leader Die cannot be sacrificed). The opposing die is not retired (This helps speeding the game).

Other Rules:
-No two dice can occupy the same square at the same time.
-A die cannot move back or diagonally (Except to capture an opposing die when using the variant).
-The game ends when no player can move any dice OR a player proposes a tie and it's accepted by the other.

At the end of the game, the face-up value of all dice at their last line is counted, and the player with the bigger score is the winner. If there is a tie, the player with most dice on his last line is the winner. If there still is a tie, the player with most dice on the board is the winner. If there is still a tie, then the game ends in a tie.

126245.name: Ben 10 Die Schlacht gegen Vilgax
126245.description:
In this action-puzzle shooting game, one player is Ben and other player his enemy - evil Vilgax.

Each player gets 3 identical figures and Omnitrix for his half of the board.
Both players shoot at the same time and try to remove the units of the opponent off the board first using the special guns.

126247.description:
Two more Petz for Dungeon Petz.


Yummy (German: Mampfi): Easy to care for, only wants to eat and eat and eat and for change: eat. Either eats meat or vegetables, depending on the turn. has rainbow coloured requirements, the owner must choose a colour a playing a card facedown before drawing cards, the face down card can not be used during this round.
Skelly (German: Knochi): Not an original pet, but a deceased imp. His kin decided to keep him. Comes with a potion from the hospital. As a skeleton, he will not and cannot eat. Every food requirement you play on him just makes him depressed. Because he won't sleep either, when using a potion on him you can choose a base requirement that will apply during exhibitions and selling.
126247.name: Dungeon Petz: Bonus Pets
boardgamepodcastepisode: I've Been Diced! episode 30: The games that got away

126248.name: Starmania Das Spiel
126248.description:
With this game You can become the next star of the year. All you need is a CD with your favorite songs and up to 5 friends. In five rounds You try to use Your star talent.

In his turn player rolls and moves and depending on the field, there are different actions: for example on Star Mania to carrying out the specified action with a song on the CD like Singing Duet, describing a song, singing with no sound etc.
Then there is a voting.
Player with the most votes as points at the end of the game is the winner.

CD and CD player are NOT included in the package.

126249.name: Build-up
126249.description:
Build-up is a board game for 2-6 people, each playing the role of a property developer, needing to complete 3 phases of property development - design, construction and marketing.

The winner is the first player to occupy the central Build up square with a ten story building - a stack of ten tiles. The players must also have a Tenant and a Topping Out card and the building must not have any mortgaged stories.

Play is on a game board with dice to move around and select various cards and/or pay/receive money etc. You also get to pick up your essential develop cards like planning permission. You get to travel in/out the board as well as clockwise around each layer (there are three).

126250.name: Trap
126250.description:
User Summary

A vertical scrolling shoot'em up split in three parts: first a run through the enemy planet's orbital defenses, then a bombing run over the planet surface. The third part is a trek on foot during which the player must collects orbs, which can be used to buy a better spaceship.

126251.name: Darkest Dungeons (Work In Progress Beta)
126251.description:
From publisher blurb:

Darkest Dungeons is a pen-and-paper role-playing game. It is a sister game to Dark Dungeons and Darker Dungeons.

Like Darker Dungeons, it is based on a specific out-of-print edition of a specific role-playing game which cannot be named for legal reasons. However, this source is a different edition/game to the source of Dark Dungeons and Darker Dungeons.

The systems used in Darkest Dungeons emulate those of a more detailed and gritty system that was originally produced as a set of third-party supplements for the game that Dark Dungeons emulate, but which was later expanded into a full game in its own right. Naturally, this source of inspiration cannot be named here or within the Darkest Dungeons book; but as with the main target of Dark Dungeons emulation you'll instantly recognise it if you have played the original - and if you haven't played the original it doesn't matter and you can enjoy the emulated version in its own right.

Like Darker Dungeons, this system is not a strict retro-clone of its source. Instead it is a blend of material inspired by the source and material taken directly from the System Reference Document (or SRD), published by Wizards of the Coast under a license called the Open Game License (or OGL).

Combat is much more dangerous and gritty than in Dark Dungeons, and even the most powerful characters may still be killed by a lucky blow. Conversely, magic - while more common than in Dark Dungeons - is less powerful than in that game.

The designer has described it as: "Darkest Dungeons was going to be around 50% BECMI/RC emulation, 20% Rolemaster 2e emulation and 30% my house rules.
"Darkest Dungeons is now around 10% BECMI/RC emulation, 70% Rolemaster 2e emulation, 10% 3.5 SRD emulation, and 10% my house rules."

126252.name: Turbo Boat Simulator
126252.description:
User Summary

A side-scrolling shoot'em up in which you control a boat stuck behind enemy lines. You must collect pieces of a map dropped by airplane while shooting enemies and dodging hazards. The game has 8 levels.

126253.name: Ultima Ratio
videogameversion: English / European ZX Spectrum Cassette edition
126253.description:
User Summary

A vertical scrolling shoot'em up game in which you must destroy the Ultima Ratio, a gigantic orbital platform threatening all life on earth. The game is split in 9 stages. To finish a stage every available target must be destroyed.

126254.name: Wanderer 3D
126254.description:
User Summary

A first-person view space shooter in which you seek to defeat the evil Vadd and his galactic empire. In order to succeed you must buy a Disrupter gun, needed to kill Vadd, and to buy the Disrupter, you need to travel back and forth between planets, picking disrupter units and selling them. Of course Vadd's minions patrol the galactic routes and shoot on sight.

Tha Amstrad CPC version of the game came with a pair of 3D glasses.

126255.name: Keltis Ór
126255.description:
In Keltis Ór, players roll 3 dice that they can reroll once. Then they must choose one of 3 options:
- Take the stones available on the dice
- Take a token from one of the 5 available colors.
This will allow the player to build ascending or descending paths as well as award a bonus (leprechaun, stone, clover, points)
- Pass

Players score in 4 different ways:
- Path length: the longer, the better. Short paths score negative
- Stones: the more, the better. Too few means a negative score
- Leprechauns: +3 for majority, -3 for minority
- Bonus points

Keltis Ór is a fascinating game. Players have a lot of freedom: paths, colors, high or low, aggressive or peaceful, pace of the game, ways of scoring, etc. The dice will make sure that every game is different. No strategy is intrinsically better: good players will adapt their play to the current situation. Clever play is rewarded.

126256.name: Canopy
126256.description:
Special version for VGG based on website and game rules

In meadows, woodlands, forests and jungles, it is the plants that grow tallest and widest that capture the most sunshine. The question is: can you grow and dominate the canopy?

Canopy is a turn-based game played on a hexagonal grid. Gameplay starts with each player taking it in turn to place a Root into an empty 'soil' hexagon along the bottom of the board. When everyone has 2 roots, normal play begins. During normal play, players can grow up and out from the roots, place additional roots, uproot other players and snap opponents' branches.

The number of roots a player has at the start of their turn is the number of moves they can make in that turn; more roots means more moves. The Grow move doesn't require a dice. Root, Uproot and Snap do rely on the dice, but players can roll the dice before deciding how to use their luck, so there's an element of strategy even in dice use.

The aim of the game is to grow your plants so that your uppermost branches cover the whole width of the board and are higher than everyone else's plants. You can also win if all the other players are out. (A player is out if they are smothered such that it's impossible for them to play a turn.) The game is played over one 'growing season' of 20 turns. If no one has completed the canopy during this season, the game ends in stalemate.

126258.name: Sudoku 2
126258.description:
A whole new way for a group to play the world's most popular numbers challenge. There are no puzzles! Just be the first to place your number cards by using the Sudoku number rules. For 2 to 8 players.

Components: Sudoku board with 81 blanks spaces. A deck of 90 cards consisting of nine sets of numbered cards (labeled 1 through 9) and nine Switch cards.

Set-up: Randomize draw deck. Place draw deck in centermost empty space. [The Draw deck has a Sudoku value of 2 until the last card is draw and space is left empty.] Give each player 5 cards to start.

On your turn: Within 15 seconds, place one card on the gameboard according to the rules of Sudoku, or place one card in your face-up area, or play a Switch card. A Switch card lets you swap a card from you hand with a card that is on the gameboard or in another player's face-up area.

Game End: Game ends after draw deck is empty, and all Switch cards have been used. Numbered cards in your hand and face-up area give you points equal to their face value (1 through 9) and Switch Cards give you 0 points. The Player(s) with the fewest points is the winner.

126259.name: Warhawk
126259.description:
User Summary

A single-player vertical scrolling shoot'em up. The back of the box says:

"Fly Warhawk into the Asteroid Belt, destroy the enemy bases and survive to fight again."

126260.name: Ship
126260.description:
User Summary

A Spanish side-scrolling shoot'em up. In addition to the usual forward-firing gun the player's ship can drop bombs on ground targets.

126261.name: Robot Revolt
126261.description:
publisher blurb

Chicago Prime is a major manufacturing world for the Galactic Confederation. But now the robots have rebelled, and in one factory, they're holding hostages. Add an envoy from an AI civilization seeking allies, and a disabled space fleet in a decaying orbit, and you've got adventure!

This Captain's Logs from the Sandbox includes star system information on the New Chicago system, a map of the Aldebaran Industries factory, information on five characters, starship and ground-based crew hazard tables, and data on three new pieces of equipment.

126262.name: Redhawk
126262.description:
User Summary

A graphical text adventure game following the adventures of Kevin Oliver, an ordinary student who can turn into the superhero Redhawk ky shouting KWAH!

The game uses a comic-book style display. Redhawk/Kevin begins the game in the hospital. There are several mysteries to solve in the game and a city to explore. The game keep track of Redhawk's popularity, money and energy (being transformed into Redhawk consumes energy, which can be replenished by turning back into Kevin). Redhawk is a superhero but he can choose to either fight crime or become a criminal himself, both options are possible.

126263.name: Kwah!
126263.description:
User Summary

A graphical text adventure and a prequel to Redhawk. Find out why Kevin Oliver/Redhawk ended in the hospital at the beginning of Redhawk.

126264.name: Future Bike Simulator
126264.description:
User Summary

A futuristic 3rd person view racing/shoot'em up game. The player pilots a futuristic antigrav bike and must complete races while avoiding or shooting down other bikers, and picking up money bonuses. Money can be used to buy power-ups or extra equipment for the bike between races.

126265.name: The Heart of Sut
126265.description:
How The Game Works
The Heart of Sut is set in a Steampunk Universe. Each player is given a secret objective. The game continues until one or more of the players have achieved their objective. Taking it in turns each player draws the next card on their adventure. If the group fails to meet the challenge laid down in front of them they must retrace the steps and take another route. Along the way they can collect some strange and exotic equipment. Can they find the Airship to help them in their travels or find uptodate victorian clockwork technology? Only the cards will tell.

Characters
Each player is given a Character that must complete an objective. The objectives are not publically known and are as follows.

Cultist - One of the other players must be killed.
Greed - Must collect 40 000GP
Horder - Must get a unique set of items
Journalist - Must collect five items from different sets.
Hunter - Must collect a trophy from each different species of creature
Adventurer - The group must find the artifact (get to the end of the roads) with no other clear winner




Start of Game
Each player is dealt four cards off the equipment deck. They may spend up to 4000GP on the equipment they have drawn and must discard the rest. Each player signifies what they have equipped by placing it on the table in front of them. Equipment usual increases the attack strength of the character. The player with the highest attack strength is given the title of Watchman and goes first.

Taking a turn
The Watchman turns over the first road card. The road cards contain one day event and one night event. Every player is expected to take part in the day event first then the watchman completes the night event alone. When both events have been completed the Watchman announce the player to their right is the new Watchman. All characters are now allowed to reequip, trade between themselves and use items. When this is finished the game continues.

If both road events are completed succesfully the card is placed down in the middle of the table to signify they are on their journey. If they fail the road card is discarded.

Events
Day Event: This can be anything from a Shop to a toll bridge to a raid by Monsters.
Night Event: This can be a travelling sales man, a theif or a night raid by Monsters.

Monsters
There are seven different species of Monster. These are broken down into three different classes. To defeat a monster you must have an attack value greater then the monster's. If you defeat the monster you get his body as a trophy and one random equipment as loot. If you cannot defeat him alone someone else can help you but all loot is discarded. If you are unable to defeat a monster you loose a peice of equipped equipment. If you have no equipment left you die and are out of the game (Causing the Cultist to win). No one can fight more then one monster a turn. There are no limits to the number of trophies a player can carry.

Equipment
Equipment falls in to five types Hat, Coat, Weapon, Gadget and One Shot. An equipment set is made up of a specified Hat, Coat, Weapon and Gadget. Hat, Coats and Weapons increase the characters attack value. Gadgets are usually useable by the whole group once one person has it equipped. No one can fight more then one monster a round with the exception of One Shots. One Shots can be used once and then must be discarded. One Shots can be played on the monster or the character fighting the monster by anyone. The player can have at most four equipment cards in his hand unless he has a gadget that allows him to have more.

Money
Every Monster Trophy and Equipment card has an amount of GP in the bottom right corner of the card. When the characters are at a shop then can discard either equipment or monster trophies for cards off the equipment draw pile at the apropriate cost. No change is given.

126266.name: Silent Shadow
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk (Budget Rerelease) edition
126266.description:
User Summary

A Spanish vertical-scrolling shoot'em up. You must punch a hole through the enemy defences to make way for the Silent Shadow, a strategic bomber following you. The game has four levels and can be played by 2 players cooperatively.

126267.name: Richelieu's Guide Compendium One
126267.description:
from the back of the book

Hark, for his eminence, Cardinal Richelieu speaks!

You may not like Cardinal Richelieu, But what he has to say might just keep you alive. You can be sure it will add a host of new elements to your All for One game, as well as greatly expand the background on the alternate 17th France.

Contained in this supplement is information on:

- The Queen's Musketeers.
- Wondrous Devices: Unusual devices, new weapons, and Da Vinci machines.
- Creatures of Sin: A host of diabolical creatures that stalk the night.
- Nobles & Courtiers: Detailing the nobility of France and the most important court positions.
- Nautical Adventures: Rules for ships and ship combat.
- The Church: A brief look at the Catholic Church
Radicals: A look at some of the radical groups threatening France
- Fencing Schools: Expanded information on the core fencing schools, plus exclusive Talents
- Guidelines for creating non-Musketeer characters, a host of example characters, and dozens of new lackeys

This information previous appeared in the first eight Richelieu Guide supplements. [User Summary - Expanded Characters; Wondrous Devices; Creatures of Sin; Nobles & Courtiers; Nautical Adventures; The Church; Radicals; Fencing Schools One]

126268.description: Sea Dogs is the boardgame of trading and piracy in the steam age. Fast-paced and multiplayer, it involves both luck and skill, has high replayability and no player elimination. The board is randomly generated with a fluctuating supply-and-demand economy. Players score by moving their ships to deliver cargo to high-demand ports. Ship parts also randomly appear, allowing players to craft their ships according to their strategy or vice versa. While essentially a trading game that can be won peacefully, piracy is always an option and defences cannot be ignored!
126268.name: Sea Dogs

126269.name: MayaQuest Trail
126269.description:
From the back of the box to the Windows/Macintosh edition

"An entire civilization has vanished!

The amazing bike adventure where YOU search for clues.

Over a thousand years ago, the Maya civilization suddenly collapsed. It's your mission to find out why!

The adventure is based on Dan Buettner's MayaQuest expeditions in which kids use the Internet to direct activities of archeologists working real Mayan digs.

As you explore ancient Maya sites, you'll rely on high-tech tools, instructions from headquarters, and a trusty mountain bike.

While on your journey, experts send you message to guide you to your next mission.

Explore seven archeological sites through a fascinating maze of artifact filled pyramids.

Educational Benefits:

Learn Maya history, geography and culture
Build exploration and critical thinking abilities
Develop computer communications concepts (Internet, e-mail)"

126270.name: SuiRuleBook & Space Combat
126270.description:
From the introduction:

Imagine if you were the last person alive in the solar system. What if the reason you were all alone was that your friends, family, and billions of others from all worlds had to flee to a nearby solar system to escape from colliding stars. Suppose, though, that the cataclysmic event prophesied didn't destroy all life after all. What if the opposite happened and previously uninhabitable planets could now support life? What would you do if you were the only witness to these things? How would you share your secret? And what if the Government in the new system planned all along to enslave your brethren once they arrived and would do anything to keep your secret from getting out? Would you have the courage to help bring freedom no matter what the cost? You'll get your chance in Sui Juris, Emancipation, a futuristic, on the edge, thrill ride that mixes a perfect blend of role playing with that of a card game. You'll get the best of both worlds like the rich storylines and plot progression, character choice, non player characters, and the chance of dice roll typical of an RPG, and the collecting, strategy and combat of a card play. Plus, you will be immersed in an incredibly vivid and imaginative world rich in history and background. All you need is a SuiGuideBook, a pair of percentile dice, and a volume full of cards. You can bring your own and add to the deck or play with a friend’s book. Enter a realm unlike any other and experience the passion of becoming a beacon of hope in an otherwise dark and dangerous region of space.

126271.name: FlowRuleBook & Mounted Combat
126271.description:
From the introduction:

Flowweaver is a fantasy role-playing game about the struggle for the balance of the Flow-a force of nature that exists in everything and infuses the inhabitants of the Tri-Worlds with special powers and abilities. Become a Weaver and intricately weave the Flow. Become a Wielder and forge great Flow weapons. Choose StormFinder and control the weather or slow time as a TimeBender. Phase through solid objects as an Oilskein. These and other Affinities will be needed by the "Callers" -- messengers of the planets themselves seeking your aid. Your adventure will likely take you to each planet that are connected by the Portals; alien chambers built by an unknown race and protected by the Portal Keepers. Flowweaver is compatible with the Flowweaver RPG rules and cards utilizing the same game concept called R.P.C. (Role-playing Cards). Flowweaver-another original game from RandymGames that tests imagination's border.

126274.description:
Twelve spiritual leaders, known as the Masters of Brilliance, have gained a great influence and many followers. At the night of solstice, they brought an unexpected end upon the world, precisely by the rules they had foretold. Anything that people could imagine happened on that night. During that tragic spectacle, the Masters of Brilliance separated wheat from chaff, taking the chosen ones to a new nice little hell they had built in a higher dimension somewhere at the doorstep of afterlife. No one knows how they got there or how they managed to affect reality. Anyway, only rigorous cooperation could grant them enough power.

The end of the world brought about by these wise guys was not as perfect as they had planned. Soon it turned out that some men left in the ashes of the past world could enter the realm of the Masters of Brilliance. Perhaps the power they cast upon the world to destroy it left a solid print? Or perhaps the transition was not that difficult?

The first man to discover he possessed this ability was Jonas Arvani. When he found out he was not the only one, he founded a guild. The boarding ability – that is, the ability to jump into a much higher plane, where the Masters of Brilliance have their twisted utopia – soon turned into an enormous business. Not everyone managed to follow the guild's strict rules. Therefore competitive undertakings began to appear that were less able and less honest. Now retrievers have been trained by guilds to steal inventions and devices from the enclave of the Masters of Brilliance. Those items become artifacts in the ruined world. The most valuable prizes are schematics that allow mankind to recreate lost devices, so that they can serve people again.

In the board game Enclave: Zakon Krańca Świata, each player starts with a retriever card along with the machine that boosts their boarding ability. During the game, which lasts six turns, players are allowed to:


Upgrade their retriever (mental and physical condition)
Upgrade their jump machine (sarcophagus and sesame)
Buy items to protect themselves from deadly traps in the enclave of the Masters of Brilliance
Buy medication needed to heal their mental damage and physical wounds
Boarding the enclave of the Masters of Brilliance to find valuable prizes and knowledge
Do the job for the "Shepherd" without any risk, but with fewer profits
Visit the oracle to peek at the future and gain initiative in the next turn
Use the character or location card on the path "to the tree"


This path is the main way to victory, known as becoming "the chosen of the Tree".


Dwunastu przywódców religijnych zwanych Mistrzami Blasku zyskało wielkie wpływy oraz mnóstwo wyznawców, aby w noc przesilenia niespodziewanie wywołać koniec świata dokładnie według przepowiedzianych przez siebie reguł.

Właściwie stało się wszystko, co tylko ludzie zdołali sobie wyobrazić. A podczas tego dramatycznego spektaklu Mistrzowie Blasku odsiewali ziarno od plew. Zabierali wybranych, żeby zbudować im nowe, miłe piekiełko w wyższym wymiarze. Gdzieś w takim przedsionku do zaświatów. Nie wiadomo, jak zdołali się tam dostać ani jakim sposobem potrafili wpływać na rzeczywistość. W każdym razie odpowiednią moc mogli uzyskać wyłącznie dzięki ścisłej współpracy.

Koniec świata panów mądrali nie był tak perfekcyjny, jak można by się spodziewać. Wkrótce okazało się, że niektórzy z ludzi pozostawionych własnemu losowi na zgliszczach minionego świata potrafią przenikać do rzeczywistości Mistrzów Blasku. Może moc, którą Mistrzowie Blasku tchnęli w świat, żeby go rozwalić, zostawiła jakiś trwały ślad? A może przejście po prostu nie jest takie trudne? Pierwszym człowiekiem, który odkrył u siebie te niezwykłe zdolności, był Jonas Arvani. Niedługo potem przekonał się, że nie jest jedyny i założył gildię.

Umiejętność dokonywania abordaży, to znaczy skoków w wyższy wymiar, w którym Mistrzowie Blasku zbudowali swoją kaleką utopię, stała się wkrótce wielkim biznesem. Gildia miała twarde zasady, którym nie każdy mógł podołać. Zaczęły powstawać konkurencyjne ugrupowania, mniej sprawne i mniej uczciwe.

Zadaniem pozyskiwaczy czy też szkolonych w gildii grabieżców jest wykradanie z enklawy Mistrzów Blasku wynalazków i urządzeń, które w zrujnowanym świecie zyskiwały rangę artefaktów. Najcenniejszymi pryzami, jakie można wynieść z abordażu, są schematy budowy urządzeń pozwalające odtworzyć daną rzecz, tak, aby znów mogła służyć ludziom.

I tak w grze planszowej każdy z graczy otrzymuje kartę pozyskiwacza wraz z maszyną wspomagającą abordaże.

Podczas rozgrywki, która będzie trwała 6 tur, gracze mają możliwość:
- ulepszać swojego pozyskiwacza (psychika i kondycja fizyczna)
- ulepszać wyposażenie maszyny do skoków (sarkofagu i sezamu)
- zakupić przedmioty umożliwiające ominięcie pułapek będących śmiertelnym zagrożeniem w enklawie Mistrzów Blasku
- zakupić niezbędne medykamenty, aby chronić swoje zdrowie psychiczne oraz fizyczne
- wykonać abordaż do enklawy Mistrzów Blasku dla cennego pryzu jak i zdobycia wiedzy
- wykonać zlecenie dla „Pasterza” bez ponoszenia ryzyka, lecz z mniejszymi korzyściami
- udać się do wyroczni celem podejrzenia swojej przyszłości, jak i przejęcia inicjatywy w kolejnej turze
- skorzystać z karty osoby lub lokacji na ścieżce „Ku Drzewu” będącej główną osia prowadzącą do zwycięstwa, jakim jest zostanie „wybrańcem mistycznego Drzewa”
126274.name: Enclave: Zakon Krańca Świata

126275.name: Rosette
126275.description:
Each player gets a secret colour. The players alternately place any of the rhombic tiles.
The game ends when all tiles are played and a large decagon is formed.

The winner is the player with the most tiles inbetween the lines of his colour.

126276.name: Kinder-Quibble
126276.description:
Children version of Quibble Das schnelle Kreuzwortspiel with picture tiles added.

A crossword puzzle game for children, in three difficulty levels, the most recent set of words to get a little knowledge of the pictures and reading the letters.

Object is to gain winning points placing the words into the crossword board.

126278.description:
With the Peloponnes: Goat Expansion, players have a new resource in Peloponnes that can be exchanged for other resources or for money. Goats are acquired when acquiring a tile or during each round (depending on where the goal icon is located on the tile) and they're tracked on the Food chart, but usable only when the player acquires a tile with a goat on it.

Peloponnes: Goat Expansion also includes a "Trade" expansion that allows the player who is last in turn order to trade one resource for another, depending on the trade tile revealed that round.

Peloponnes: Goat Expansion includes components for another player, allowing for play with up to seven players if the first expansion is also used.
126278.name: Peloponnes: Goat Expansion

126286.name: Killed Until Dead
126286.description:
User Summary

A graphical adventure game in which you must prevent a murder. You can talk to suspects, search their hotel rooms and use surveillance cameras. The back of the box says:

"Five of the world's best selling murder mystery writers known as The Murder Club have once again convened for their annual reunion at the Gargoyle Hotel. They will each try to bump off the others and lay claim to the crown of "World's Greatest Murderer". Only you stand in the way! As Hercule Holmes the famous detective, you have until midnight to discover the would be victim - if you fail someone will surely be killed - yes Killed Until Dead!"

126288.name: La Aventura Espacial
videogameversion: Spanish Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
126288.description:
User Summary

A Spanish graphical text adventure game. Fresh out of the Galactic Confederations's Survival School, you are sent to investigate and destroy and mysterious threat to galactic peace.

126289.name: La Aventura Original
videogameversion: Spanish Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
126289.description:
User Summary

A Spanish graphical text adventure. You set out to explore the subterranean realm of the Elven Kings, in search of 14 fabulous treasures rumored to have been hidden there.

126304.name: Extreme Skater
126304.description:
User Summary

Skateboarding in your pocket! Skate through 78 levels with realistic tilt controls while unlocking new tricks and boards!

126305.name: Mini Pets
126305.description:
User Summary

Take care of pets and their babies while building shelters to house them. Tons of decorating options to personalize your shelter.

126309.name: Cozumel
126309.description:
User Summary

A graphical text adventure game, and the first in the Ci-U-Than trilogy of games.

It's 1920 and after a short stop in Cuba to resupply, Doc Monro is on his way to Yucatan when a sudden storm capsizes his ship. He is now stranded in the middle of the Carribean Sea...

126310.name: Los Templos Sagrados
videogameversion: Spanish Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
126310.description:
User Summary

Spanish graphical text adventure game, and second part of the Ci-U-Than trilogy. Follow Doc Monro as he explores ancient temples in the jungle of Yucatan, in search for clues about the location of the Lost City of Chichen Itza. Like the previous game, Los Templos Sagrados is split in two parts.

126311.name: Chichen Itza
126311.description:
User Summary

Spanish graphical text adventure game, and last part of the Ci-U-Than trilogy. Doc Monro has finally reached the Sacred City of Chichen Itza. All that is left is to explore the city, and uncover the secret hidden in the Temple of Quetzalcoatl.

126312.name: W.E.L.D.E.R.
126312.description:
Fight back in the war against words! Weld words in the W.E.L.D.E.R. word machine – addiction guaranteed!

- Create clever combos and multiply your score using gold and gem tiles
- Increase your vocabulary using iOS 5’s in-built dictionary and discover definitions of words you never even knew existed!
- Earn powerful special abilities like Group, Reverse, and Jump Swaps, and complete particularly tricky words with blank wooden pieces.

Also supports iOS5’s iCloud for playing games across multiple devices.

Source: The Publisher Website.

126313.name: Sovereign Chess
126313.description:
The theme of Sovereign Chess is chess on a larger board (16x16) with multiple colors of neutral pieces around the edge of the board.

Each player begins with a normal complement of chess pieces--one player is black, and the other is white. Moves follow that of traditional chess, with a few variations--most notably that pawns may move orthogonally (and capture diagonally) toward the center of the board.

When a player's piece is on a colored square, she controls the pieces of that color. Players can control multiple colors at once, either with a number of their own pieces, or through a "chain" of pieces. For example, if the white player has her pawn on a red square, and then moves a red pawn to the blue square, then she controls both red and blue.

The goal of the game is to checkmate the opposing king.

126314.name: Greyfell: The Legend of Norman
126314.description:
User Summary

Isometric 3D action adventure game. Norman, an alcoholic cat, is on a quest to retrieve the Orb of Life (stolen by the evil Mauron) and bring back happiness to the land of Greyfell. In order to find the Orb, he must collect items and exchange them for clues. Of course there are dangerous monsters along the way, but Norman can cast spells to defend himself.

126315.name: Hybrid (1987)
126315.description:
User Summary
